description: - 20/20 / The Inner Eye / Mutant Spider: Smaller tears orbits the main tear.
- 20/20 / The Inner Eye / Mutant Spider: Smaller tears orbits the main tear.
- 20/20 / The Inner Eye / Mutant Spider: Smaller tears orbits the main tear.

- {{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Azazel}}: The same effect as Brimstone, dealing full damage (Tainted Azazel's default laser damage is halved unless Hemoptysis is used first). Tainted Azazel can no longer use Hemoptysis.
- Angelic Prism: While the tear is in contact with the prism, it will fire 4 additional tears in cardinal directions at Isaac's tear rate.
- Backstabber: Much easier to inflict bleeding and double damage on most enemies.

- Berserk!: The tear can't be controlled while berserking but it can be batted around the room until the effect ends.
 - {{C|Tainted Samson}}: uses a passive form of Berserk! that works the same way.

- Brimstone: Tear takes the shape of a very large laser ring. {{Dlc|nr}} The shot speed is ignored. The Tears stat is ignored and the damage is dealt very rapidly at a rate equivalent to 1 tear delay. This ring will always be present and doesn't need charging up like normal Brimstone would.
 - '''Brimstone''' + Incubus: Incubus' Brimstone laser is not affected by Ludovico Technique.
  - {{Dlc|r}} Adds a smaller controllable laser ring in addition to the main one.
 - {{Dlc|r}} '''Brimstone''' + Ipecac: +2 damage, beam explodes when colliding with enemies and obstacles.
 - '''Brimstone''' + A Lump of Coal: The ring increases in diameter, but not the damage, the farther away it gets from Isaac.
 - '''Brimstone''' + Spoon Bender: The ring reaches out to attack enemies near it, reforming into a ring when no enemies are present.
 - '''Brimstone''' + Technology: The ring is visually identical to a normal Brimstone ring, but the 1.5x damage multiplier applies.
 - '''Brimstone''' + 20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: no effect.
- Compound Fracture: Turns tear into a large bone, which shoots out smaller tears when attacking/touching an enemy. Scattered tears are spectral and piercing.
- Dead Eye: Damage bonus increases until it hits the max of 2x. Since the controllable tear never hits the ground or wall, the bonus cannot be lost.

- Dr. Fetus: A bomb is shot out at high speed and can be controlled, another bomb cannot be shot until the previously shot bomb has detonated.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Causes your tears to act like Epic Fetus and now inherits all synergies Epic Fetus has.
- Eye of the Occult: While holding a direction key, the Ludovico tear will constantly shoot out controllable tears in random directions. The air time of these tears scales with the range stat.
- Fate's Reward: The familiar gains spectral and piercing tears.

- Flat Stone: The tear starts bouncing at a rate somewhat below Isaac's fire rate, each bounce dealing splash damage.
 - '''Flat Stone''' + Ipecac: Causes a poisonous explosion when it bounces instead of plain splash damage, as per normal Ipecac. The first bounce when entering a room does not explode, allowing moving the tear with less risk of self-damage.

- Fruit Cake: The tear will cycle through different effects, based on Isaac's tear rate.
 - (Added in Afterbirth+, Removed in Repentance) If Isaac stays in one room long enough the Ludovico tear will often fill the room with many stationary Trisagion tears that last until Isaac leaves the room. This combination can easily clear most rooms.

- Godhead: The tear homes towards nearby enemies and gains a large damaging aura. However, the aura cannot damage an enemy that is in contact with the actual tear; barring a high tear rate, it may be better to keep the aura on the enemies instead of the tear.
- holy light: The Ludovico tear will release holy beams on itself periodically while touching an enemy.

- Incubus|anr: Isaac gains a controlled tear while also being able to shoot normally with Incubus. Incubus's tears gain piercing and spectral properties.
 - (Added in Repentance) Incubus creates a second smaller Ludovico Technique tear instead, which can both be controlled by Isaac. The second tear is slightly delayed/ outside of the main tear. This may cause it to not hit enemies sometimes.
 - (Added in Repentance) {{C|Lilith}}: Lilith's incubus will fire a smaller Ludovico Technique tear. For each doubled incubus caused by Box of Friends, there will be an additional Ludovico Technique tear that spawns on Lilith's location.

- Lead Pencil|a+nr: The tear blinks red, but the effect is entirely cosmetic.
 - (Added in Repentance) Tear barrages are launched in cardinal directions, even when not controlling the tear. Proc rate depends on fire rate.

- Lodestone: The single floating tear will flash grey to indicate that the magnetism might apply on hit. Like Strange Attractor, enemies tagged with magnetism will also draw the floating tear towards said enemy.
- Loki's Horns: The Ludovico tear will sometimes shoot 4 smaller tears in each cardinal direction.
- Lost Contact: Tear will block enemy tears without disappearing.
- A Lump of Coal: The tear becomes larger the further away it is from Isaac, increasing in damage.
- Mom's Eye: The Ludovico tear has a chance on each damage tick to fire a smaller tear in a random direction. This chance scales with luck and goes up to 100% at 10 Luck.

- (Removed in Afterbirth+) Mom's Wig: The item causes spiders to spawn rapidly when moving the tear.
 - (Added in Repentance) Causes Spiders to rapidly spawn until the cap of 5 is reached.

- Monstro's Lung: Tear turns red and does more damage.
 - (Added in Afterbirth) Tear becomes a cluster of variously sized tears spread over a small area. The tears move at the same speed when controlled but constantly move around each other.
- Mysterious Liquid: Creep continuously oozes from underneath the tear.
- My Reflection: The shot speed multiplier causes the tear to move significantly faster, allowing it to catch up to any fast-moving enemies.
- The Parasite: Shoots out smaller tears when attacking an enemy. Scattered tears are spectral and piercing.
- Pause: The tear deals damage, even if the enemies are stopped. Moving the tear unpauses the enemies.

- Strange Attractor: Enemies, items and even most bosses will be sucked to the single floating tear, dealing constant damage while keeping Isaac well away from harm, making this combination extremely effective in almost all scenarios.
- Tear Detonator: The tear explodes into six smaller tears, then reappears next to the player.

- Technology: The tear becomes a large laser ring, which visually looks like a shot fired by Tech X|n. Shot speed is ignored. The Tears stat is ignored and the damage is dealt very rapidly at a rate equivalent to 1 tear delay.

- Technology: The tear becomes a large laser ring, which visually looks like a shot fired by Tech X|n. Shot speed is ignored. The Tears stat is ignored and the damage is dealt very rapidly at a rate equivalent to 1 tear delay.
- Tech.5: The tear controls as usual, and Isaac fires the laser towards the tear relative to his position, rather than in the direction the player is moving the tear.
- Abyss: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Cricket's Head it turns into a larger red locust dealing triple Isaac’s damage per tick.

- Berserk!: For some reason, as you gain more kills while berserk, Libra steadily increases the damage, tears, and range stat with seemingly no limit, allowing massively high DPS, but targets are much more difficult to hit as the range of the swing gradually extending outwards more and more with each kill.

- Soy Milk: As tear delay is valued very highly by the formula, greatly increases all stats.
 - (Added in Repentance) Soy Milk is only a minor DPS upgrade, and as such a very minor all stats up.
- Ipecac: Can be rapidly fired with decreased damage.

- Rock Bottom: Stats will increase as a result of items, get locked at the highest point, and then be balanced out via Libra allowing items like Ipecac and Soy Milk to have higher damage/shot speed respectively.
- Taurus: Gradually increases all stats in an incomplete room. Libra prevents Isaac from becoming invincible (unless with high stats), and stat increases will remain until the end of the fight.

- {{T|Tape Worm}}: As range is valued very highly by the formula, greatly increases all stats. Synergizes well with Mom's Box.
 - (Added in Repentance) Tape Worm is a flat +3 range instead of x2, resulting in only a small all stats up.
- Blood Clot / Chemical Peel: Every second row of tears has increased damage.
- Blood Clot / Chemical Peel: Every second row of tears has increased damage.
- (Added in Afterbirth)Brimstone: Two Brimstone shots are fired, without an increase in charge time.

- Diplopia|anr: Every additional 20/20 adds 2 more tears in a tight pattern.
 - (Added in Repentance) Adds one more tear without further lowering damage.
- (Added in Afterbirth)Doctor's Remote / Epic Fetus: Replaces the single missile strike with a barrage of two consecutive missiles.
- (Added in Afterbirth)Doctor's Remote / Epic Fetus: Replaces the single missile strike with a barrage of two consecutive missiles.

- (Added in Afterbirth, Removed in Repentance)The Inner Eye / Mutant Spider: Adds two/three tears to each shot, with no extra fire rate decrease.
 - (Added in Repentance) Removes the fire rate penalty while reducing damage to 75%. Additional copies will add one additional tear with no further change to damage/fire rate.

- (Added in Afterbirth, Removed in Repentance)The Inner Eye / Mutant Spider: Adds two/three tears to each shot, with no extra fire rate decrease.
 - (Added in Repentance) Removes the fire rate penalty while reducing damage to 75%. Additional copies will add one additional tear with no further change to damage/fire rate.
- The Ludovico Technique: The Ludovico tear gains one smaller tear orbiting the main one, each dealing the same amount of damage.
- (Added in Afterbirth)Monstro's Lung: Adds two tears to the tear barrage, for a total of 16.
- {{Dlc|r}}Polyphemus: Grants additional +5 flat damage and removes the fire rate penalty, firing 2 tears per shot.
- Sprinkler: Fires two tears at once that almost completely overlap each other.
- {{Dlc|a}}Technology: Fires two technology shots simultaneously.
- Tractor Beam: Both tears are fired along the beam. Only one tear can be seen, as they overlap each other.
- The Wiz: Two tears are fired in each direction.

- {{C|Keeper|a}}: The Wooden Nickel|n and the 9 Volt allow him to gain health (and money) forever, as long as there is an enemy in the room.
 - An enemy spawned in a cleared room will also cause recharging to start.
- telekinesis|r the active item can be reactivated the moment the previous charge stops, making it always active

- Friendly Ball|force=r: Walking over a captured enemy will double charge the ball, allowing the enemy to be released, and allowing to catch a new one in the same room, and the process repeats. This allows the Friendly Ball to be used much, ''much'' more often, and gathering many more friends. Note: trying to catch a new enemy while the old one is in the process of spawning will result in the ball phasing through, catching nothing, thus wasting charge.
- {{Dlc|r}} Notched Axe: Causes remaining charge from the previous floor to carry over to the next one.
- Ghost Pepper: Poison farts shoot a fire behind Isaac.
- Spindown Dice: Turns into Brimstone when rerolled by Spindown Dice.
- Spindown Dice: Turns into Brimstone when rerolled by Spindown Dice.
- Almond Milk/Soy Milk: The damage of Blood Clot is unaffected by the damage multiplier, significantly increasing DPS.
- Almond Milk/Soy Milk: The damage of Blood Clot is unaffected by the damage multiplier, significantly increasing DPS.
- Dr. Fetus: Turns all bombs red and increases their damage.
- Epic Fetus: Missiles have a high chance to deal 20 points more damage with a red explosion.
- Monstro's Lung: Effect is applied every time you shoot.

- Saturnus: Orbiting tears will be the same as the last fired tear before leaving the previous room. To guarantee orbiting tears with the Blood Clot damage bonus, your last fired tear before leaving a room must come from the left eye.
- Technology 2: As the laser from Technology 2 occupies your right eye, all tears now fired from the left eye have the statistical benefit of Blood Clot applied.

- The Wiz: Blood Clot applies on both eyes, meaning the second shot from either eye will always be a Blood Clot shot. It will randomly alternate which shot of the two eyes counts for the other's Blood Clot shot if you fire multiple tears per shot like with Cursed Eye.
- Birthright + {{C|Samson}}: Birthright allows him to gain 4 more damage boosts at the same +0.2 intervals, for a new maximum total of +14.0.
- Dull Razor: Safely provides the damage boost without needing to take damage.
- Abyss: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Blood of the Martyr it turns into a red locust dealing double Isaac’s damage per tick.

- The Book of Belial / XV - The Devil: Applies an additional 1.5x damage multiplier.
 - The x1.5 damage multiplier does not stack with the x1.5 damage multiplier from Magic Mushroom and Cricket's Head.
- Dr. Fetus: The bombs that Isaac fires will be homing.
- BFFS!: The familiar drops bombs in a repeating pattern of 2, 2 then 3 rooms.

- Almond Milk: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge. The beam lasts indefinitely as long as the fire key is held. The beam can change its direction while being fired, and can be aimed in any direction with joystick controls. The beam will also gain random worm trinket effects.
 - Increasing tears stat will increase damage and width brimstone as well.
  - Damage per Tick = Damage × Fire Rate ÷ 5

- {{Dlc|nr}} Apple! / Euthanasia / Tough Love: The beam can gain the damage multiplier from each of the items, although there is no visual difference. The bonus applies for the whole beam and not on a per-tick basis. Euthanasia loses its instant kill ability, however.
 - {{Dlc|r}} The bonus applies randomly on every tick of the beam, including the insta-kill ability from Euthanasia.

- {{Dlc|nr}} Apple! / Euthanasia / Tough Love: The beam can gain the damage multiplier from each of the items, although there is no visual difference. The bonus applies for the whole beam and not on a per-tick basis. Euthanasia loses its instant kill ability, however.
 - {{Dlc|r}} The bonus applies randomly on every tick of the beam, including the insta-kill ability from Euthanasia.

- {{Dlc|nr}} Apple! / Euthanasia / Tough Love: The beam can gain the damage multiplier from each of the items, although there is no visual difference. The bonus applies for the whole beam and not on a per-tick basis. Euthanasia loses its instant kill ability, however.
 - {{Dlc|r}} The bonus applies randomly on every tick of the beam, including the insta-kill ability from Euthanasia.

- Anti-Gravity: An orb of energy expands, then shrinks while firing the beam after a delay. The orb still hurts enemies if they touch it. Isaac can start charging a new shot immediately after releasing the fire key without canceling the first shot, effectively allowing for a faster firing rate. It makes it harder to hit enemies with {{C|Azazel}} as the beam does not increase in range. {{Dlc|r}} Size and damage of the beams no longer scale with fire rate as well as lasting infinitely at above 15 fire rate.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Anti-Gravity + Soy Milk / Almond Milk: Allows auto firing upon full charge but without permanent beam uptime.
 - {{Dlc|anr}} Anti-Gravity + Incubus: Isaac will fire Brimstone orbs, while Incubus will fire regular Brimstone beams.
  - {{Dlc|r}} Both Isaac and Incubus fire Brimstone orbs.

- C Section: Shoots 4 fetus tears along with the brimstone beam
 - The Ludovico Technique: Fetus tears no longer fire with Brimstone circle, even on doing damage.

- Chocolate Milk|force=r: Brimstone laser takes longer to fully charge but can be released at any point. Width and damage of the laser increases with charge, from 25% damage and 50% width at minimum charge to 250% damage and 160% width at maximum charge.
- Dataminer: Dataminer can be used to underflow Isaac's tears to immediately bring it to 120, maxing out Brimstone's width and damage via tears.
- Multidimensional Baby: If a brimstone laser is shot through the baby, it will double the laser.
- Eye of the Occult: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge. The beam curves towards the crosshair and then attempts to hit the wall Isaac is facing.

- Haemolacria: +20 Tear Delay after Haemolacria's tears down. Tears burst into 4-7 Brimstone beams that do Isaac's damage per tick.
 - {{C|Azazel}}/ {{C|Tainted Azazel}}: Overrides these characters' Brimstone. Tears do not burst into Brimstone beams.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Double Brimstone: Grants +1 Damage but not the 1.2x damage multiplier. The width of the beams doubles.
 - Haemolacria + Chocolate Milk: The Brimstone beams deal full damage regardless of charge.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Haemolacria + Technology: The lasers coil the beams. This is purely visual and does not grant a 1.5x damage multiplier.

- Hemoptysis: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage Brimstone deals to 2x and +3 flat damage. Enemies who die to Brimstone under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies.
- Loki's Horns: Adds a chance to shoot a beam from all four cardinal directions, similarly to Head of Krampus's effect.
- Loki's Horns: Adds a chance to shoot a beam from all four cardinal directions, similarly to Head of Krampus's effect.

- The Ludovico Technique: The Ludovico Technique has priority. The beam forms a large ring that is controllable and does not need to be charged. The damage is dealt 15 times per second, unaffected by Tears. Enemies inside the ring without touching it are not hurt.
 - The Ludovico Technique + multi-shot effect: No effect.
 - The Ludovico Technique + C Section: Disables C Section. Fetuses no longer spawn.
 - The Ludovico Technique + Incubus:
  - {{Dlc|nr}} Incubus' Brimstone laser is not affected by Ludovico Technique.
  - {{Dlc|r}} Adds a smaller controllable laser ring in addition to the main one.
 - The Ludovico Technique + A Lump of Coal: The ring increases in diameter when Isaac is further; 100% when he is on the center, 1.25x when he is 12.5 tiles of distance away.
  - {{Dlc|nr}} The damage does not increase on distance.
  - {{Dlc|r}} The damage increase 20% per tile of distance.
 - The Ludovico Technique + Mom's Knife: Overrides Brimstone.
 - The Ludovico Technique + Proptosis: The ring increases in diameter when Isaac is closer; 1.25x when he is on the center, 100% when he is 12.5 tiles of distance away.
  - {{Dlc|r}} The ring deals 1.5x Isaac's Damage at its largest, and 50% at its smallest.

- A Lump of Coal|force=a: The beam gradually increases in size and damage the farther it travels, with the damage increasing on a multiplier that is +20% per tile of distance. This allows for a huge damage increase from longer distances.
- Mom's Eye: Adds a chance to shoot a beam from the back of Isaac's head.

- Mom's Knife: Mom's Knife has priority. Does not apply Brimstone's tears down. Adds a small barrage of knives after the main knife is fired, with each knife doing {{Dlc|nr}} 80% of /{{Dlc|r}} 2x Isaac's tear damage. This effect does not work with {{C|Azazel}}'s Brimstone.
 - The barrage of knives goes all the way across the screen and does not return.
 - Charge amount increases the barrage size; 2-4 knives at 0%, 8-10 knives 100%.
- Mom's Wig|force=na+: Holding down a fire button to charge the attack very rapidly rolls the probability to spawn Familiar#Blue Spiders|blue spiders; releasing to fire the beam, however, does not.

- My Reflection:
 - {{Dlc|na}} Overridden by Brimstone.
 - {{Dlc|anr}} Makes the beam curve when moving. It has the same effect on {{C|Azazel}}'s mini-brimstone but doubles the range.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Makes the beam shoot from the back. An oval beam is shot from the front instead.
- Ocular Rift: Rifts may appear where the beam hits rocks, walls or enemies.

- Sad Bombs: Upon exploding, bombs release ten beams in all directions.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Brimstone does not benefit from Sad Bombs' flat damage bonus.

- Soy Milk|force=r: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge. The beam lasts indefinitely as long as the fire key is held. The beam can change its direction while being fired, and can be aimed in any direction with joystick controls.
 - Increasing tears will also increase damage.
  - Damage per Tick = Damage × Fire Rate / 5
 - Soy Milk|force=r + Chocolate Milk: The beam does 25% more damage. Does not increase Isaac's damage stat itself.
- Strange Attractor: Enemies are attracted towards the beam, improving its consistency. Consumables will also be moved by the beam.
- Sulfur: Grants a larger beam with a 1.2x damage multiplier and +1 damage (same effect as picking up a second Brimstone).

- Tammy's Head: Shoots ten beams in all directions. Given the item's single room charge, this makes for an extremely powerful synergy.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Brimstone does not benefit from Tammy's Head's flat damage bonus anymore.

- Tech X: Tech X has priority. Does not apply Brimstone's tears down. Fires a Brimstone ring. This Brimstone ring is larger than the laser ring and has a much wider hitbox.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Double Brimstone: Further increases the width of the ring, and grants +1 Damage.
 - Tech X + {{C|Azazel}}:
  - {{Dlc|na+}} Overridden by Azazel's Brimstone.
  - {{Dlc|a+nr}} Overrides Azazel's Brimstone. This works quite well with Azazel's good initial damage stat and also negates his initial range penalty.
  - {{Dlc|r}} Applies 35% damage penalty and fires a Brimstone ring instead of Tech X ring. If combined with Brimstone, the damage penalty is negated.
   - The same applies to {{C|Tainted Azazel}}.
 - {{Dlc|nr}} Tech X + Mom's Knife: Mom's Knife and a Mom's Knife + Brimstone barrage are shot alongside the rings.
 - {{Dlc|nr}} Tech X + Technology: The 1.5x damage multiplier from Brimstone + Technology is lost, but the laser fires while charging the Brimstone ring.
  - {{Dlc|r}} Fires a Brimstone ring coiled by a laser. The 1.5x damage multiplier from Brimstone + Technology is retained.

- Tiny Planet: The beam will wrap around Isaac once and then shoot straight forward.
 - If combined with My Reflection, the beam will first wrap around Isaac, form an oval beam in a longer range, then shoot backward. Interestingly enough, the beam will look like a G clef symbol.
- Uranus: The beam will freeze any enemies killed by it, so long as they are not immune to the freeze effect.
- BFFS!: All future drops will happen every 3 coins. If the next scheduled drop at the moment of acquiring BFFS! requires more than 3 coins, the amount will not be lowered.
- Mitre: Red Hearts that Bum drops can be converted into Soul Hearts.
- {{Dlc|r}}The Polaroid, Virgo: Can trigger at the same time as The Polaroid or Virgo, cumulating to up to 22 seconds of shield.
- {{Dlc|r}}The Polaroid, Virgo: Can trigger at the same time as The Polaroid or Virgo, cumulating to up to 22 seconds of shield.
- Abyss: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb The Common Cold it turns into a green locust that poisons enemies.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Haemolacria/The Parasite: Chance for tears and split tears to be poisonous. If the main tear is poisonous, the split tears are too.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Haemolacria/The Parasite: Chance for tears and split tears to be poisonous. If the main tear is poisonous, the split tears are too.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Haemolacria/The Parasite: Chance for tears and split tears to be poisonous. If the main tear is poisonous, the split tears are too.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Haemolacria/The Parasite: Chance for tears and split tears to be poisonous. If the main tear is poisonous, the split tears are too.
- Dr. Fetus/Epic Fetus: Chance for bombs/explosions to become poisonous like Bob's Curse.
- Dr. Fetus/Epic Fetus: Chance for bombs/explosions to become poisonous like Bob's Curse.
- Dr. Fetus/Epic Fetus: Chance for bombs/explosions to become poisonous like Bob's Curse.
- Finger!: Finger can also apply the poison effect.
- Lachryphagy: If a poison tear is fed, all burst tears are poisonous. If a normal tear is fed, the burst tears are not poisonous.
- The Ludovico Technique: The tear flickers green, capable of poisoning enemies when it does.
- 20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Fires multiple charged shots.
- 20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Fires multiple charged shots.
- 20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Fires multiple charged shots.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Split tears do half the damage of normal tears.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Split tears do half the damage of normal tears.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/The Parasite: Split tears do half the damage of normal tears.
- Godhead: Charging the shots increase the size and damage of the aura.

- Haemolacria: Increased tear delay. Completely charged shots and their burst tears are larger and deal higher damage than normal. Chocolate Milk also allows low-damage Haemolacria shots to be fired rapidly.

- {{Dlc|nr}}Isaac's Tears/Sad Bombs/Tammy's Head: The size and damage of all generated tears correspond to the current charge level of Chocolate Milk. Isaac's Tears will nearly instantly recharge while charging a Chocolate Milk shot.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Charge level does not effect generated tears. Isaac's Tears recharge only when a shot is fired.

- {{Dlc|nr}}Isaac's Tears/Sad Bombs/Tammy's Head: The size and damage of all generated tears correspond to the current charge level of Chocolate Milk. Isaac's Tears will nearly instantly recharge while charging a Chocolate Milk shot.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Charge level does not effect generated tears. Isaac's Tears recharge only when a shot is fired.

- {{Dlc|nr}}Isaac's Tears/Sad Bombs/Tammy's Head: The size and damage of all generated tears correspond to the current charge level of Chocolate Milk. Isaac's Tears will nearly instantly recharge while charging a Chocolate Milk shot.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Charge level does not effect generated tears. Isaac's Tears recharge only when a shot is fired.

- Ipecac: Increased tear delay. Charged shots deal massively increased damage, as the +40 damage from Ipecac is run through the damage multiplier of Chocolate Milk. It also allows low-damage Ipecac shots to be fired rapidly.

- Lachryphagy: Rapidly firing small, uncharged tears can cause the fed tear to grow into a gigantic tear that will still deal fairly low damage while feeding tears with charged tears will result in higher-damage tears.

- {{Dlc|nr}}Mom's Wig: Spiders rapidly spawn while charging.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Spiders spawn only when a shot is fired.

- Monstro's Lung: (Removed in Repentance) Reduces Isaac's current tear delay by 20%, allowing Monstro's Lung to charge faster. Each tear from Monstro's Lung is also a charged Chocolate Milk shot, massively increasing damage.
 - (Added in Repentance) Tear delay is increased, and the tear damage, along with the amount of tears fired is dependent on charge time.
- Polyphemus: Increased tear delay. Massively increases the damage of each shot, and charged tears decay in damage much slower as a result.
- Sinus Infection: Booger damage is influenced by the damage of the individual tear, so fully-charged Chocolate Milk shots can result in very potent damage over time.

- Technology 2: Damage dealt by the laser is equal to Isaac's current charge, leading to constant high damage from a safe distance.
 - {{Dlc|r}} The laser deals 13% of Isaac's damage regardless of charge, tears are affected by Chocolate Milk as normal.
- Trisagion: Fully charged beams deal four times normal damage. Trisagion's shots are colored brown.
- 20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Every other set of tears has the Chemical Peel effect.
- 20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Every other set of tears has the Chemical Peel effect.
- 20/20/The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: Every other set of tears has the Chemical Peel effect.
- Brimstone: The entire laser has a high chance to have the Chemical Peel effect, with no visual difference.
- Dr. Fetus: The damage bonus applies to every bomb, with no visual difference.
- Epic Fetus: The missiles have a high chance to deal 40 points extra damage, with no visual difference.
- Lead Pencil: All tears in the tear barrage will gain the Chemical Peel effect.
- The Ludovico Technique: The tear flashes between normal and the higher-damaging Chemical Peel tear.
- Mom's Knife: Each tick of the Knife's damage has a high chance to gain the bonus, with no visual difference.
- Soy Milk: Chemical Peel is unaffected by Soy Milk's damage down modifier, greatly increasing DPS.
- Tech.5: Chemical Peel has a chance to apply to the laser, with no visual difference.
- Technology: Lasers have a high chance to gain extra damage, with no visual difference.
- Technology 2: Every tear fired has Chemical Peel applied to it, but the laser is unaffected.
- Book of Revelations: Ensures that Harbingers that haven't already been defeated will replace their respective floor's boss, making it drastically easier to collect multiple Cubes of Meat.
- Box of Friends / Monster Manual: Additional copies of Cube of Meat combine with the first, increasing its level as normal.
- Box of Friends / Monster Manual: Additional copies of Cube of Meat combine with the first, increasing its level as normal.
- Potato Peeler: Consumes 1 Heart Container in return for creating 1 Cube of Meat and increasing damage a little.
- BFFS! / Hive Mind: Increases the foot's size and doubles its damage. Both items cannot be stacked for an even stronger effect.
- BFFS! / Hive Mind: Increases the foot's size and doubles its damage. Both items cannot be stacked for an even stronger effect.
- Box of Friends: Spawns an additional foot for the rest of the room.

- Gnawed Leaf: Allows Isaac to stay invincible while Daddy Longlegs clears the Rooms|room, granting Isaac a slow but effective way of completely avoiding damage. This combination is especially useful as {{C|The Lost}}.
- Spin to Win: Boosts the foot's damage while spinning.
- Diplopia: Isaac gains 18 extra lives in total.
- Box of Friends: If used without having any familiars, a Demon Baby will be spawned for the remainder of the current Rooms|room.
- Chocolate Milk: Shoots at enemies while charging up a shot, thus giving Isaac an alternative way to kill enemies while charging a shot.
- Apple! / Euthanasia: Damage multiplier may be applied to the non-flat damage without a visual difference. Euthanasia bombs do not retain the instant kill ability.

- Brimstone Bombs: The activation rate of the Brimstone lasers is random and dependent on Luck. The chance is 11% at 0 Luck, increasing by 3% per luck. This maximizes at 100% at 29.67 luck and minimizes at 0% at -3.67 luck.

- Cricket's Body|a: The bombs split outwards into 4 tiny bombs, which detonate almost immediately.
 - {{Dlc|r}} The split bombs deal a flat 35 damage.

- C Section: C Section has priority. Does not apply Dr. Fetus' tears down. The fetuses drop small bombs when they touch an enemy. The bomb's damage follows Dr. Fetus' damage calculation, based on half of the fetuses damage. A fetus can drop only one bomb.
 - The fetuses' bombs do not benefit from Isaac's bomb effects such as Hot Bombs or Bobby-Bomb. However, they do benefit from Isaac's tear effects and have appearance of the corresponding bombs. For example, Hot Bombs from Fire Mind, Bobby-Bomb from Tear Effects|Homing Tears. As such, Cricket's Body, The Parasite and Polyphemus leave a subsequent bomb or bombs, and Mysterious Liquid leaves a creep.
 - C Section + Ipecac: The fetuses explode before dropping any bomb.
- '''Dr. Fetus''': Additional copies of this item, such as from Diplopia / Crooked Penny, grants a multi-shot effect without tears down.

- Blood Clot: +1 damage bonus on the left eye. Blood Clot tears are unaffected by the damage penalty.
- (Added in Repentance) Brimstone/{{c|Azazel}}: Beam can be fired continuously after charging.
- Chemical Peel: +2 damage bonus on the left eye. Chemical Peel tears are unaffected by the damage penalty.

- {{Dlc|nr}}Chocolate Milk: Shots cannot be charged, but Isaac gains a flat +1 damage up after the Soy Milk penalty.
 - (Added in Repentance) Shoots moderately charged shots at a quick pace. No longer gives +1 damage.
- (Added in Repentance) Cursed Eye: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge. This may be riskier than Cursed Eye alone because Soy Milk prevents Isaac from holding a fully charged shot.

- Explosivo: Despite the tiny appearance of the bomb tears, the explosions will do normal explosion damage. Due to the massive fire rate, many bombs can be applied in extremely quick succession, decimating anything after a short delay.

- {{Dlc|nr}} Dr. Fetus: Allows for incredibly fast firing medium damage bombs.
 - (Added in Repentance) Fires tiny bombs, like the kinds created by Scatter Bombs|n. Damage downgrade applies as normal.
- Ipecac: The very fast rate of fire fills the screen with low damage explosions.

- {{Dlc|nr}} Libra: Decreases fire rate slightly, but massively increases damage, range, and speed. Tear height is also massively increased, meaning tears can hit enemies through obstacles without spectral effect.
 - (Added in Repentance) Resets stats to slightly higher than base level.
 - (Added in Repentance) '''Libra''' + Brimstone: Constant Brimstone beam at normal/higher damage.
- Lost Contact: Extremely effective at blocking shots.

- A Lump of Coal: Significantly increases tear damage as they get further away. Even with only this synergy, individual tear damage appears to approach starting tear damage when firing over longer distances.
- {{Dlc|r}} Monstro's Lung: Automatically charges and fires tear barrages.
- The Mulligan: Will generate an enormous wave of blue flies given that each tear has a 1/6 chance of spawning one.
- Mysterious Liquid: Each shot creates creep that deals reasonable damage but stacks with every shot, causing hefty damage.
- Pisces: Greatly increases knockback, allowing tears to pin enemies against walls.
- Rock Bottom: If Soy Milk is picked up at an opportune time (after Rock Bottom and preferably near the end of the run), it will result in a huge gain in fire rate without the damage penalty.

- Tech X|r: Automatically charges and fires fully charged Tech X rings. Non-fully charged rings can still be fired by releasing the fire key during charging, but much harder due to the high fire rate and removal of charge bar.

- Technology Zero: The near-constant stream of tears will have electricity chained between them, providing an electrical net of damage making it almost impossible to not hit an enemy. This can greatly help offset the lowered damage by increasing the number of hits.
- Ghost Pepper: Shoots a flame behind Isaac upon each use of Butter Bean. Two flames will be shot if Isaac also has Car Battery|n.
- Ghost Pepper: Shoots a flame behind Isaac upon each use of Butter Bean. Two flames will be shot if Isaac also has Car Battery|n.
- (Removed in Afterbirth+) Brimstone / Chocolate Milk / Cursed Eye / Mom's Knife / Monstro's Lung / Tech X: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession.
- (Removed in Afterbirth+) Brimstone / Chocolate Milk / Cursed Eye / Mom's Knife / Monstro's Lung / Tech X: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession.
- (Removed in Afterbirth+) Brimstone / Chocolate Milk / Cursed Eye / Mom's Knife / Monstro's Lung / Tech X: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession.
- (Removed in Afterbirth+) Brimstone / Chocolate Milk / Cursed Eye / Mom's Knife / Monstro's Lung / Tech X: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession.
- (Removed in Afterbirth+) Brimstone / Chocolate Milk / Cursed Eye / Mom's Knife / Monstro's Lung / Tech X: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession.
- (Removed in Afterbirth+) Brimstone / Chocolate Milk / Cursed Eye / Mom's Knife / Monstro's Lung / Tech X: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession.
- Epic Fetus / The Ludovico Technique / Marked: Moving the tear/crosshair around will spawn spiders rapidly.
- Epic Fetus / The Ludovico Technique / Marked: Moving the tear/crosshair around will spawn spiders rapidly.
- Epic Fetus / The Ludovico Technique / Marked: Moving the tear/crosshair around will spawn spiders rapidly.
- Hive Mind: Doubles the limit to 10 spiders, in addition to boosting the damage of spiders per the item's base effect.
- Apple!|r / Tough Love|r: Creep does not appear visually different but has a chance to deal bonus damage.
- Apple!|r / Tough Love|r: Creep does not appear visually different but has a chance to deal bonus damage.
- Ipecac|r: Creep becomes green and poisons enemies but does not explode.
- Knockout Drops: Creep knocks back any enemies that touch it.
- A Lump of Coal: Creep does more damage the farther Isaac is from the enemy.
- Proptosis|r: Creep deals 2x Isaac's damage instead of 66%.

- Abyss: When Polyphemus is picked up instead of being converted into a locust, it grants all of Abyss's locusts the high damage up without suffering the tears down allowing Isaac to increase his damage rate substantially the more items he uses Abyss on.
- Dr. Fetus: Increases tear delay, and after the first bomb explodes, a second bomb appears where the first one exploded, doing roughly half the damage of the first.
- The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: The tear rate is not lowered further, but the effect on damage becomes a flat +5 bonus instead.
- The Inner Eye/Mutant Spider: The tear rate is not lowered further, but the effect on damage becomes a flat +5 bonus instead.
- Rock Bottom: Allows Isaac to keep his previous fire rate in addition to the massive damage boost.
- Shard of Glass|r: The rapidly spawning red tears do full damage.
- Little C.H.A.D.: Each Half Red Heart dropped by Little C.H.A.D. can be collected by Dark Bum, increasing the amount of pickups dropped.

- Gimpy: Enemy kills have the chance to drop Half Red Hearts that can be collected by Dark Bum, which when combined with Gimpy's chance to drop Soul Hearts when Isaac is damaged is a good way to generate Black Hearts as well as other pickups.
- Humbling Bundle: Most Red Heart drops will become Double Red Heart drops. This counts as two full Red Hearts for Dark Bum, essentially doubling the value of it.

- 7 Seals: One of the more versatile familiars that works with Gnawed Leaf. The varied forms and attacks of this familiar make it capable of clearing pretty much any room given time. The locusts it produces often fly to Isaac which takes care of chasing enemies, but its damaging creep and chasing attacks can reach even the farthest enemies.

- 120 Volt: With enough damage, 120 Volt's zaps becomes far more efficient at killing than orbitals.
 - At 15 damage minimum, it surpasses most orbitals.
 - At 30 damage or more, it surpasses Sacrificial Dagger.

- Angry Fly: Aggressively attacks enemies even if they're far away, but can end up harmlessly orbiting slow or stationary enemies indefinitely, or trying to attack invulnerable enemies. It does better with slow or stationary bosses than regular enemies, diving in to attack periodically instead of harmlessly orbiting.

- Daddy Longlegs: Allows Isaac to easily clear most rooms or bosses while in statue form. Daddy Longlegs cannot damage bosses like The Shell and won't target enemies that are a long distance from Isaac. In a pinch, {{T|mom's toenail}} works the same, albeit much slower.
- Damocles: If Isaac is in statue form when the sword falls, he will survive.
- Dark Arts: While Isaac is surrounded by enemies, he will not take damage and will safely go into the shadow state. (Even if enemies are in pointblank range.)
- Decap Attack: The head can be used on stationary bosses to wither them down.
- E. Coli /Midas' Touch /serpent's kiss / The Virus: Monsters touching the statue will be affected without Isaac taking collision damage.
- E. Coli /Midas' Touch /serpent's kiss / The Virus: Monsters touching the statue will be affected without Isaac taking collision damage.
- E. Coli /Midas' Touch /serpent's kiss / The Virus: Monsters touching the statue will be affected without Isaac taking collision damage.
- E. Coli /Midas' Touch /serpent's kiss / The Virus: Monsters touching the statue will be affected without Isaac taking collision damage.
- empty vessel: if Empty Vessel's requirement is fulfilled, Isaac can safely wait for the shield to activate, allowing to deal damage without leaving invulnerability.
- IBS: Orbitals and other things(such as 120 Volt) can trigger IBS while in statue form, however, Isaac will still be invincible. This can be really good if a Stinky Poop is held above his head.
- Kamikaze!: Statue form will break, but the initial explosion will not damage Isaac, therefore granting Isaac quasi-unlimited bombs.

- The Ludovico Technique: The hovering tear will still deal damage and the statue form won't break as long as the attack buttons aren't being pressed.
 - '''The Ludovico Technique''' + Strange Attractor: Can pull enemies in while remaining a statue, clearing out rooms easily.
- Mom's Knife: The knife can damage enemies while Isaac is a statue.
- {{Dlc|r}}Mom's Heels: While invincible, Isaac can still deal contact damage.
- Monstrance: The aura makes quick work of chasing enemies.
- The Pinking Shears: Isaac's body will attack enemies while his head is invincible.
- Placenta: Isaac can safely regenerate Red Hearts in any room, making it easy to have enough health from any mistake at the cost of time.
- Robo-Baby 2.0: Since it fires automatically, this familiar is one of the more effective synergies, since it will even shoot off screen as it’s knocked around.

- Salvation: The aura can trigger from nearby enemies while Isaac is safely a statue, and the damaging beams when this happens can reach farther enemies. This powerful attack can make quick work of bosses that chase Isaac.
- Spin to Win: Gnawed Leaf will activate while using Spin to Win, as long as Isaac is stationary. This allows for a brief moment of high damage against enemies that chase Isaac.

- Sprinkler: Can be placed upon entering a room, and will continue to fire when Isaac is invincible, meaning any room can be cleared without the risk of Isaac taking damage. This theoretically allows end-game bosses to be beaten without having to move.

- (Added in Repentance){{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The Soul is invincible as long as the bone club is not used and The Forgotten is not thrown, even if The Soul is holding The Forgotten and moving around. Combined with orbitals that deal contact damage like Cube of Meat or items that can trigger damage only by movement such as Purgatory, can make for a trivial method to beat any boss.

- (Added in Repentance){{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The Soul is invincible as long as the bone club is not used and The Forgotten is not thrown, even if The Soul is holding The Forgotten and moving around. Combined with orbitals that deal contact damage like Cube of Meat or items that can trigger damage only by movement such as Purgatory, can make for a trivial method to beat any boss.

- Tooth and Nail: Allows one second to act and/or reposition without taking damage. Useful in situations such as ranged combat when enemies bombard from a distance, or to attack and move to a safe distance where Isaac can safely regain statue form.
- Duality: Both Angel and Devil Room doors spawn after every boss, and the selected door will never disappear.
- act of contrition: Gives a 50/50 chance to spawn either a Devil Room or Angel Room, then permanently opens then chosen room.

- (Removed in Repentance) Blood Rights: While Isaac is invincible, Blood Rights can be freely used without taking damage. This trivializes many rooms, and since Taurus can activate every room, this combination can be game-changing, especially if Isaac has high base speed.
 - (Added in Repentance) Isaac will still take damage from Blood Rights during the invincibility.
- Gnawed Leaf: Isaac's speed will still increase while he is invincible from Gnawed Leaf, allowing Taurus to activate with only a very small period of vulnerability when first entering a room.
- Rock Bottom: Isaac keeps the maximum speed boost after reaching it once.
- Serpent's Kiss/The Virus: Isaac will poison enemies in addition to dealing damage to them on contact.
- Serpent's Kiss/The Virus: Isaac will poison enemies in addition to dealing damage to them on contact.
- Abyss: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Number One it turns into a yellow locust that is faster, deals damage quicker, but has a limited range.
- Brimstone / {{c|Tainted Azazel|r}}: The laser turns yellow and charges at a much faster rate with no decrease to the range.
- Epic Fetus: Increases fire-rate with no decrease in range. Explosive clouds are now yellow.
- Incubus: The Incubus fires at a much faster rate with no decrease to the range.
- Ipecac: Increase fire rate moderately and decreases range only slightly.
- The Ludovico Technique: Turns tear yellow and allows it to be moved much faster.
- Number One: Gives an additional fire rate bonus without further reducing range.
- Pop!: Eyeball tears are yellow, can be fired much quicker, and does not affect their airtime.
- Technology: The laser turns yellow and Technology's firing rate is greatly increased with no decrease to the range.
- Tech X: Laser turns yellow, charge time is greatly decreased, and no decrease to the range.
- Tiny Planet: Tears travel roughly the same distance but can be fired much quicker.

- Anti-Gravity: The tears will not decrease in size or damage until they start moving, making this excellent against enemies that chase Isaac.
 - '''Anti-Gravity''' + Eye of the Occult: Lets Isaac maintain the full 3× damage multiplier while controlling his tears.

- Brimstone: Retains the double damage effect without losing damage over range.
 - (Added in Afterbirth) Damage is doubled again for a total of 4x next to Isaac, but quickly drops further along the beam, at about 0.8x per tile of distance.
 - (Added in Repentance) The beam does 6x damage at point blank range.

- (Removed in Repentance) Dr. Fetus/Epic Fetus: Doubles damage with no penalty for distance.
 - (Added in Repentance) Triples/quadruples damage respectively.

- (Removed in Repentance) Dr. Fetus/Epic Fetus: Doubles damage with no penalty for distance.
 - (Added in Repentance) Triples/quadruples damage respectively.
- Godhead: The damaging halo shrinks with the tears.

- A Lump of Coal: Proptosis scales with Isaac's damage while the Lump of Coal does not. At base damage, the Lump of Coal will approximately negate the damage lost over distance, but with increased damage, tears still do more damage up close.
 - '''A Lump of Coal''' + The Ludovico Technique: The controlled tear has full Proptosis damage buff, (Removed in Repentance) no matter how far it is from Isaac. (Added in Repentance) Very slightly decreases damage from far away.
- Mom's Knife: The Knife damage is (Removed in Repentance) doubled ((Added in Repentance) tripled), regardless of range.
- Polyphemus: Tears do massive damage and carry with leftover damage while still shrinking.

- Technology/Technology 2: Doubles damage.
 - (Added in Afterbirth) The beam decreases in damage and width the farther it travels. Tears become virtually powerless across large rooms like the Boss Rush and the Hush fight.
 - (Added in Repentance) The beams do 6x damage at point blank range.

- Technology/Technology 2: Doubles damage.
 - (Added in Afterbirth) The beam decreases in damage and width the farther it travels. Tears become virtually powerless across large rooms like the Boss Rush and the Hush fight.
 - (Added in Repentance) The beams do 6x damage at point blank range.
- Tech X: Ring size and damage is substantially increased, but decreases as the ring travels further from Isaac.

- Trisagion|a+nr: Base damage is doubled and beam damage is boosted to about 65%. Blasts lose no power as they travel further, though the tips of the blasts deal very slightly less damage.
 - (Added in Repentance) Damage slightly increased, beam damage is doubled. Blasts lose no power with distance.
- Bird's Eye: Size and damage of fires is increased, but does not decrease with range.

- {{c|Azazel}} / Brimstone: Isaac will fire Brimstone lasers in all directions. (Removed in Repentance) Each laser is given bonus damage.
 - This will deal a substantial amount of damage near the center of the effect due to how lasers overlap the closer you get to Isaac.
- Car Battery: Shoots 20 tears in a circle around Isaac.
- (Removed in Repentance)Chocolate Milk: The size and damage of tears shot depends on how far Chocolate Milk is charged.
- C Section: Fetuses stand in place while the fire button is held. They will still home on enemies in this state. Fetuses attacking this way deal more damage.
- Lachryphagy: Tears will float in midair, making them easier to feed. Burst tears will also float in midair before moving.
- Proptosis: The tears will not decrease in size or damage until they start moving, making this excellent against enemies that chase Isaac.
- {{Dlc|r}}Tech.5: Creates floating laser balls that will all fire simultaneously when the fire button is released.
- Technology Zero: All of the tears fired are connected by electricity, creating a series of electric fences.

- (Removed in Repentance)Tiny Planet: Tears stay in place until released, they will start to orbit around Isaac when released.
 - (Added in Repentance) Tears orbit close to Isaac when held, then snap to the edge of the orbit when released.
- Abyss: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb Fire Mind it turns into a burning locust that sets enemies on fire but does not explode.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Haemolacria/The Parasite: Each fractal tear has its own chance to explode. However, if the main tear explodes, all fractal tears explode.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Haemolacria/The Parasite: Each fractal tear has its own chance to explode. However, if the main tear explodes, all fractal tears explode.

- {{dlc|na}} Death's Touch: Adds burn damage to the scythes, but will not cause explosions.
- Dr. Fetus: All Dr. Fetus bombs will leave a flame behind after exploding, similar to the effect of Hot Bombs.
- Dr. Fetus: All Dr. Fetus bombs will leave a flame behind after exploding, similar to the effect of Hot Bombs.

- Finger!: Finger familiar can set enemies on fire but won't cause explosions.

- (Added in Repentance)notched axe: Picking up Iron Bar will refill Notched Axe's charge bar.
- Anti-Gravity: Placing many tears around Isaac creates a safe zone, especially with larger tears.
- Brimstone/Technology/Technology 2: Beam/laser destroys projectiles, although only during its damage tick interval. The projectiles are not instantly destroyed when they touch the beam/laser.

- Eye of Belial: Piercing through a projectile will trigger Eye of Belial's double damage and homing effect. Belial tears will still block shots.
- Jacob's Ladder|force=r: Destroyed tears via shot-blocking will trigger the electric arc effect.
- The Ludovico Technique: Can block an infinite amount of enemy shots if the tear is placed on top of a monster. The projectiles that they attempt to shoot will be immediately destroyed.
- Mom's Knife: The knife will destroy projectiles in its path without being affected.
- Polyphemus: Enemy shots are treated like enemies with 10 health, which are deducted from the Polyphemus tear. If it has strength remaining afterward, it will continue.
- Sinus Infection/Mucormycosis: Tears that stick to enemies will block shots, and will not be destroyed in the process.

- 20/20: Each shot fires two tears in opposing orbital directions.
- Brimstone: The beam will wrap around the character and shoot straight forward.
- Cricket's Body: Tears will split into 2 close groups of 2 tears that follow the orbit. One group travels clockwise and the other travels counterclockwise.

- Eye of Belial|r: After piercing an enemy, instead of homing in on enemies, tears will continue to orbit, but each tear can pierce multiple enemies to gain more size and damage multipliers.
- Flat Stone: Tears will bounce and orbit around the character.
- Godhead: Tears with damaging auras orbit the character, creating a damaging barrier.
- Ipecac: Explosive tears orbit around Isaac. Host Hat or Pyromaniac is highly recommended.

- Loki's Horns: Effectively grants a great tear multiplier, as the extra tears from Loki's Horns will follow the trajectory given by the Tiny Planet.
- Lost Contact: Shielded tears will orbit Isaac, granting a partially successful 360-degree projectile protection around him. Works better with a faster fire rate.

- A Lump of Coal: This item drastically increases the screen time of tears because it makes them orbit around Isaac for a few seconds. A Lump Of Coal adds a lot of damage to tears in "outer orbit".
 - the tears do not fall during the beast fight allowing tears to grow bigger and bigger
- Marked: Isaac will continuously fire orbiting tears, which allows him to not touch the attack keys and focus just on moving (with giant tears it makes it hard to see as he can't stop firing).

- Revelation: The beam of light wraps around Isaac and shoots forward at a slight angle, similar to Brimstone.

- Rubber Cement: Tears bounce off enemies then keep orbiting Isaac. Very powerful as the tears are not destroyed upon damaging an enemy. When near walls, the orbiting tears tend to get stuck against the walls until Isaac moves away.

- Spirit Sword|r: The sword's melee attack becomes disjointed from Isaac, hitting in an increased range in front of him but creating a blind spot where the strike used to be. Spin attacks also occur in front of Isaac instead of around him. Sword projectiles orbit around Isaac as normal.
- (Added in Repentance){{C|Tainted Lilith}}: Tears orbit around the Gello instead of the character.

- 4.5 Volt: With some damage source while this item is active, it can be permanently invulnerable inside the room while you have enemies.

- ???'s Only Friend: The fly can still be controlled while invincible.

- Mom's Knife does contact damage in the same direction it was being held at the time of using it, giving a massive amount of free damage by ramming into an enemy.
 - If you have the Yes Mother? Transformation, you can basically do the same thing using this item.

- On contact items (Aries, The Virus, etc.): Freely usable in basically every 4 rooms.

- Dark Arts: Kamikaze can be used for free while Dark Arts is active.
- Glitter Bombs: Has a chance to drop a pickup or trinket each time it is used.
- Gnawed Leaf: Activating Kamikaze will cancel out of the statue state, but Isaac will not be damaged by the resulting explosion.

- Host Hat / Pyromaniac: Allows unlimited uses without consequences.
 - Pyromaniac: Each use will heal Isaac for (Removed in Repentance) one full / (Added in Repentance) half a red heart.

- Mars: Isaac is invincible during the dash, allowing for unlimited uses with careful timing.

- Schoolbag: The cooldown before the player can use Kamikaze! again is eliminated when switching items. Depending on how fast the player can push the buttons, Kamikaze! can be used multiple times during Isaac's invincibility frames.
- Remote Detonator + Schoolbag: The Mr. Boom bomb is affected by remote detonator.
- Remote Detonator + Schoolbag: The Mr. Boom bomb is affected by remote detonator.

- {{T|A Missing Page|r}} / Missing Page 2|r: Increases the damage from 40 to 80.
 - '''A Missing Page''' + '''Missing Page 2''': The damage increase stacks for a total of 120 damage.
- Anti-Gravity|r: Melee attacks will generate a hovering tear in the shape of the swing of the pickaxe.
- The Battery|r: Causes remaining charge from the previous floor to carry over to the next one.
- Ipecac|r: Melee attacks will trigger an explosion when they makes contact with an enemy; unlike with the Forgotten's bone club, Isaac ''will'' take damage from these Ipecac explosions.
- Iron Bar|r: Fully recharges the axe when picked up.
- Technology|r: Melee attacks will cause a technology laser ring to appear around Isaac, damaging enemies.
- Mars: Lowers the dash cooldown to approximately 1 second.
- Bird's Eye / Ghost Pepper: Fire will appear behind Isaac when The Poop is used.
- Bird's Eye / Ghost Pepper: Fire will appear behind Isaac when The Poop is used.
- {{T|Brown Cap}}: The Poop may be used as a discounted Mine Crafter, both for utility, as well as combat.
- Dirty Mind: Allows the creation of extra friendly Dip|ns.
- Hallowed Ground: Using The Poop will always spawn a white poop|n.
- Midas' Touch: Using The Poop has a chance to spawn golden poop. The chance of this effect is 100% at 4 Luck.
- (Removed in Repentance)Isaac's Heart: Isaac cannot take damage from the Razor Blade, allowing for infinite uses of the item.
- Old Bandage / Shard of Glass: Isaac has a chance to drop a red heart while using the item.
- Old Bandage / Shard of Glass: Isaac has a chance to drop a red heart while using the item.
- (Removed in Repentance)The Polaroid: Isaac takes no damage while invincible, allowing for repeated free uses of the item.
- The Wafer: Isaac loses half a heart instead of a full heart.

- Whore of Babylon: The Razor Blade can be used to activate this item's effect by doing enough damage to get Isaac down to half a red heart (or one red heart as Eve), providing a big damage boost for the current room at the cost of health.
- Birthright &{{c|Judas}}: Actives the effect of The Necronomicon alongside its normal effect.
- Birthright &{{c|Judas}}: Actives the effect of The Necronomicon alongside its normal effect.
- 4.5 Volt: Allows the item to be charged and used multiple times in a room, which can help with dealing extra damage in enduring fights like most endgame bosses.
- 9 Volt: Can be used once every room, and more frequently in Challenge Rooms.

- Hemoptysis: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage the laser deals to 4x and +3 flat damage (instead of just 2x). Enemies who die to the laser under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies.
- Mars: Lowers the dash cooldown to approximately 1 second.
- BFFS! / Hive Mind|force=r: Big Fan becomes visually larger and deals more damage. Collision radius is not increased, however.
- BFFS! / Hive Mind|force=r: Big Fan becomes visually larger and deals more damage. Collision radius is not increased, however.
- (Added in Afterbirth)Black Candle: Teleport effect is removed.
- (Added in Afterbirth)Holy Mantle: Losing Holy Mantle while charging Cursed Eye will not teleport Isaac.

- Incubus:
 - (Added in Afterbirth+, Removed in Repentance) Incubus fires 3 tears for each one that normally would be fired, with no change in delay.
 - (Added in Repentance) Incubus has the same charge shots as most characters would. Getting hit while charging will have the chance to teleport, as usual.

- Marked: Tears are charged and automatically fired to varying levels depending on the distance between Isaac and the reticule. The firing rate is greatly increased without affecting the tears stat, even beyond normal maximum fire rate. The teleport effect is removed.
- (Added in Repentance) Technology: Becomes a quick charging laser that shoots multiple lasers on release.
- Epiphora|force=r: Epiphora's tear rate multiplier affects the number of tears in a burst for a total of ten shots with a full Epiphora charge.

- Technology 2: Laser fires while charging Cursed Eye. Tear delay for the charge is unaffected by Tech 2. Allows {{C|Cain}} to fire normal tears.
 - (Added in Repentance) Tears are replaced with lasers, fired from the same eye of Tech 2.
- Mutant Spider: Fires 4 tears out of each eye, for a total of 16 tears when fully charged.
- Blood Oath: Each half-heart lost has a chance of spawning a pickup from the fanny pack.
- Sharp Plug: Each half a heart lost from the use of sharp plug has a chance of spawning a picking from the fanny pack.
- Brown Nugget: Turret does 7 damage instead of 3.5
- Mom's Wig: Doubles spider limit of the wig to 10 spiders.
- Plum Flute: Doubles Baby Plum's contact damage, but not projectile damage. Plum is also larger.
- Sissy Longlegs: Increases familiar's size. Spiders spawned by Sissy are affected by Hive Mind.
- BFFS!: Juicy Sack spawns an extra Blue Spider.
- BFFS!: The beam deals double damage.

- Hemoptysis: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage the Brimstone beam deals to 8 damage per tick. Enemies who die to the Brimstone beam under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies.
 - Hemoptysis + BFFS!: The curse causes the beam's damage to be increased to 13 damage per tick.
- {{Dlc+|r}} King Baby / Marked: While firing, Brimstone will be charged automatically and fired immediately upon full charge, the beam will now target the nearest enemy/crosshair.{{dlc-}}
- {{Dlc+|r}} King Baby / Marked: While firing, Brimstone will be charged automatically and fired immediately upon full charge, the beam will now target the nearest enemy/crosshair.{{dlc-}}
- BFFS!: The familiar drops hearts in a repeating pattern of 2, 2 then 3 rooms.
- Mom's Eye: Each time Mom's Eye would activate, Loki's Horns activates instead.
- Eye of the Occult: Extra tears will fire in the same direction.
- Sprinkler: The sprinkler eye turns into four eyes and alternates shots between the cardinal and ordinal directions.
- Tiny Planet: Effectively grants a great tear multiplier, as on item activation the extra tears will follow the trajectory given by the Tiny Planet.
- Compound Fracture/Cricket's Body/Haemolacria/The Parasite: If the main tear causes petrification, split tears will too.

- Continuum: Tears shot out of the back reappear on the opposite side of the screen.
- Eye of the Occult: Mom's Eye tears follow the direction in which Isaac is shooting.
- Loki's Horns: Any time Mom's Eye would activate, Loki's Horns activates instead.
- Rubber Cement: Tears bounce around, making the backward tear more likely to hit enemies.
- Mom's Knife: Another knife is permanently behind Isaac, able to deal contact damage. The fire chance is still affected by luck as usual.
- Brimstone: Beam will be colored pink and applies the charming effect.
- Compound Fracture / Cricket's Body / Haemolacria / The Parasite: Split tears will retain the charm effect if main tear had the charm effect.

- The Ludovico Technique: Tear flickers pink, capable of charming enemies when it does.

- Almond Milk / Soy Milk|force=r: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge.
- Almond Milk / Soy Milk|force=r: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge.
- Anti-Gravity: Hover effect is overidden, but tear delay down still applies, which greatly reduces the charge time.

- Blood Clot: All tears are larger, with increased damage (as opposed to every 2nd tear like Blood Clot alone).
 - {{Dlc|a+}} Tears have a 50% chance to be Blood Clot tears.

- Brimstone|force=a: Brimstone has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. Fires 3-5 additional beams in random directions around Isaac. This effect also applies to {{C|Azazel}} and {{Dlc|r}}{{C|Tainted Azazel}}'s versions of Brimstone.
 - Brimstone + Eye Sore: Overrides this synergy with a chance to shoot 1-3 additional beams in random directions.

- Chocolate Milk|nr: Reduces Isaac's tear delay by 20%, and each tear from Monstro's Lung is a charged Chocolate Milk shot, massively increasing fire rate and damage.
 - This does not apply to {{C|Lilith}}'s Incubus; picking up Chocolate Milk will significantly reduce damage and increase charge time.
 - {{Dlc|r}} The tear damage and the barrage size scale with charge amount. At 50% charge, the tear damage is 100%, the barrage size reaches 100% and is capped there. At 100% charge, the tear damage is 200%.
  - \text{Charge Time (s)} = \frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\text{Tear Delay} \times \frac{5}{2} + 1)) \approx \frac{5}{2 \times \text{Fire Rate}}
   - This makes damage per second drop to 80%.
- Eye Sore: Adds a chance to fire 1-3 additional barrages in random directions.

- Dr. Fetus|force=a: Monstro's Lung has priority. Does not apply Dr. Fetus' tears down. Fires 6 bombs which detonate simultaneously.
 - Multi-shot effects add 1 bomb to the barrage, up to 21 bombs.
- Epic Fetus|force=a: Epic Fetus has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. 2-4 extra cursors rotate around the main cursor before the missiles land.
- Flat Stone: All tears bounce simultaneously; the effective range is greatly increased.

- Haemolacria: Monstro's Lung has priority. Applies +43 Tear Delay after Haemolacria tears down, instead of Monstro's Lung tears down. The barrage size is reduced to 4/7 (roughly 0.57), tears of which all burst.
 - The barrage size is 8 without any multi-shot effect. The resulting amount is rounded, and is capped at 29.

- Ipecac: Fires Ipecac tears, with no increase in charge time.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Applies Ipecac's tears down.

- Technology|force=r: Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. Grants a charged shot, fires 12 lasers in 30° spead that arc 3-4 times. A laser can hit an enemy multiple times between their arcings.
 - \text{Charge Time (s)} = \frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\frac{43}{10} (\text{Tear Delay} + 1))) \approx \frac{43}{10 \times \text{Fire Rate}}
  - This is equivalent of applying Monstro's Lung's tears down and its charge time, without actually altering tear delay.
 - Multi-shot effects add 12 lasers to the barrage, up to 128 lasers total.
 - Technology + Mysterious Liquid: The lasers leave creep each time they arc, resulting in a massive amount of creep.
 - Technology + Proptosis: The 6x damage is recovered each time they arc, nearly nullifying the distance penalty.

- Tech X: Fires 3-5 extra rings in 30° spead. Extra rings deal from 50% to 100% damage of the main ring.
 - Additional copy of Monstro's Lung adds 3-5 more rings.
 - {{Dlc|nr}} Increases Tear Delay.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Fire Rate is divided by 3.1.
- The Ludovico Technique|force=a: The Ludovico Technique has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. A cluster of variably sized tears orbit the main tear.

- Mom's Knife|force=a: Mom's Knife has priority. Does not apply Monstro's Lung's tears down. Fires additional knives depending on charge amount, each dealing 2x tear damage. Fires 3-5 knives at maximum charge.

- Mom's Wig|nr: Charging an attack spawns spiders in rapid succession.
 - {{Dlc|r}} Spawns spiders upon firing, not charging. The amount of spiders spawned is dependent on luck.

- '''Monstro's Lung''': Additional copies of this item, such as from Diplopia / Crooked Penny, add {{Dlc|nr}} 10/{{Dlc|r}} 12 tears to the barrage.
 - This effects is equivalent of adding {{Dlc|nr}} 4/{{Dlc|r}} 5 multi-shot effects. The items which have priority over Monstro's Lung or override it (e.g. Brimstone/C Section) benefit from this multi-shot effect.

- '''Monstro's Lung''': Additional copies of this item, such as from Diplopia / Crooked Penny, add {{Dlc|nr}} 10/{{Dlc|r}} 12 tears to the barrage.
 - This effects is equivalent of adding {{Dlc|nr}} 4/{{Dlc|r}} 5 multi-shot effects. The items which have priority over Monstro's Lung or override it (e.g. Brimstone/C Section) benefit from this multi-shot effect.
- My Reflection: Tears stay in the air much longer and consistently, allowing better reach and more focused blasts before the tears returning to Isaac.
- Tractor Beam: All the tears follow the beam at different heights without spreading out, making it much easier for multiple tears to hit a target.
- Brimstone: Constantly spawns blue flies when attacking.
- Chocolate Milk: The Mulligan's ability isn't affected by the charge time, meaning rapidly firing uncharged shots will generate a ton of blue flies.
- Cricket's Body / The Parasite: Has a 1/6 chance to spawn a fly on every hit by a split shot, which boosts the spawning of flies immensely.
- Cricket's Body / The Parasite: Has a 1/6 chance to spawn a fly on every hit by a split shot, which boosts the spawning of flies immensely.
- Finger!: Rapidly spawns blue flies when pointed at an enemy.
- Blood Oath: For each half heart damaged by Blood Oath, Old Bandage has a chance to drop a heart. Synergy further improves with luck.
- The Parasite: When tears pass through solid objects, like rocks, they will split, resulting in many tears shooting out from every rock the original tear passed through.
- Angelic Prism: All tears split by the prism will burst into split tears when hitting obstacles.
- Bob's Rotten Head: Two further explosions appear perpendicular to the head's direction of travel when it blows up.
- C Section: Fetuses fire short-ranged tears constantly while in contact with an enemy.
- Compound Fracture: Both tear split effects happen simultaneously.
- Continuum / Spectral tears: When tears pass through solid objects, like rocks, they will split, resulting in many tears shooting out from every rock the original tear passed through.
- Cricket's Body: Two groups of this item's four tears, creating eight additional miniature tears on every point of impact instead.
- Flat Stone: Every time tears bounce, burst tears spawn.
- holy light: As the holy effect is applied before the split, both tears will be holy if a holy tear is split
- Lachryphagy: Fed tears split into 12 tears. When tears are minimally fed and hit an obstacle, they will split into 5 Lachryphagy burst tears and Parasite burst tears.
- Lead Pencil / Monstro's Lung: All tears in tear barrage will burst into split tears when hitting obstacles or enemies.
- Lead Pencil / Monstro's Lung: All tears in tear barrage will burst into split tears when hitting obstacles or enemies.
- The Ludovico Technique: Repeatedly spawns miniature tears when on top of an enemy, greatly increasing damage.
- Tiny Planet: The split tears will continue to orbit Isaac, increasing damage potential.

- Tractor Beam: The split tears will be forced directly forward, impacting whatever caused the first tear to split. This increases damage immensely.
 - If all shots connect, effective damage will be multiplied by 2 + log2(damage).
- Trisagion: When beams hit obstacles, the beam will split; the split beams can split again when hitting other obstacles.
- BFFS!: The familiar requires one less room clear to drop a soul heart.
- Mongo Baby: Mongo Baby will also spawn flies.

- (Added in Afterbirth) Brimstone: The blood laser bounces off of walls, creating a second beam that deals half damage.
 - (Added in Afterbirth) {{C|Azazel}}'s Brimstone laser becomes a full length laser after bouncing, but will deal half of the damage.
  - (Added in Afterbirth+) {{C|Azazel}}'s Brimstone no longer becomes a full length laser after bouncing, and instead bounce as a regular mini-Brimstone.
- A Lump of Coal: Both effects stack, with tears that bounce off of enemies being able to hit others for more damage.
- The Parasite: Tears will bounce off of walls without splitting, but split and bounce when hitting enemies. The split tears and the original one will bounce off everything.

- Pop!: Significantly increases the uptime of tears, since they are not limited by range and each tear will bounce off of each other. Continuously firing tears will eventually create a positive feedback loop, as the tears will keep bouncing faster and faster while not dropping to the floor.
 - '''Pop!''' + A Lump Of Coal: Extremely powerful combination; Lump of Coal's tear size increase will make it much easier for tears to bounce off of each other, while they increase in damage very rapidly. Given some time and enough tears, this can kill even final bosses such as Hush and Delirium quickly.
- (Added in Afterbirth) Technology / Technology 2 / Tech.5: Laser bounces off walls, creating a second beam that does half damage.
- (Added in Afterbirth) Technology / Technology 2 / Tech.5: Laser bounces off walls, creating a second beam that does half damage.
- (Added in Afterbirth) Technology / Technology 2 / Tech.5: Laser bounces off walls, creating a second beam that does half damage.
- Tech X|r: The laser rings bounce off walls once.
- BFFS!: The familiar drops coins in a repeating pattern of 1, 2, 2 then 2 rooms.

- {{dlc+|anr}} Diplopia: Can be used to create two Steam Sales, reducing the price of all items in the shop to 0.
 - '''Diplopia''' + Restock or Greed mode: Restock will allow shop items to replenish indefinitely, so by having multiple Steam Sales by the methods above, infinite items may be purchased. Be careful not to pick up Missing No., which will remove the Steam Sales and will likely replace many items with Breakfast.{{dlc-}}
- {{dlc+|r}} Diplopia: Each additional Steam Sale will further reduce the price of all items in the shop, down to a minimum of 1 cent.{{dlc-}}
- {{t|Liberty Cap|nr}}: If Liberty Cap triggers the effect of The Compass, it will last for the remainder of the floor.

- Contract From Below: Single pickup drops have a 2/3 chance to be doubled, which then become their doubled versions by Humbling Bundle. This essentially results in an average increase from 1.33x more pickups to 2.67x more.
 - (Added in Repentance) The average gain is reduced to 2x more pickups instead.
- The Jar|nr: Allows for replicating hearts. Using the jar with 4 hearts inside it will cause 8 to drop, allowing Isaac to create an infinite amount of Red Hearts.
- Maggy's Bow: Allows all normal heart pickups to be worth four hearts. However it's bugged sometimes{{reconfirm}}.
- Brimstone: Enemies and pickups are sucked towards the beam, increasing accuracy significantly.
- Dr. Fetus: Enemies are sucked towards bombs, increasing accuracy and making enemies easier to kill.
- Explosivo: When the shot sticks to an enemy, every enemy near it will be attracted to them.
- Godhead: Enemies will be pulled into Godhead's damaging aura, increasing the aura's effectiveness at causing damage.
- Ipecac: Enemies and pickups are pulled towards the shots, increasing accuracy. The color of shots and their explosive effect is a darker green.

- The Ludovico Technique: Enemies, items, and even most bosses will be sucked to the single floating tear, dealing constant damage while keeping Isaac well away from harm, making this combination extremely effective in almost all scenarios.
- Mom's Knife: Enemies are pulled towards the knife. The effect is minor while not firing and much stronger while the knife is launched.

- Technology/Technology 2/Tech.5: The beam will attract enemies, often sucking them into the beam and holding them there.
- Technology/Technology 2/Tech.5: The beam will attract enemies, often sucking them into the beam and holding them there.
- Technology/Technology 2/Tech.5: The beam will attract enemies, often sucking them into the beam and holding them there.
- Tech X: Enemies and pickups are attracted to the outer ring, increasing accuracy.
- Tractor Beam: The lack of random spread and momentum-based trajectories on tears makes the way enemies are pulled around more predictable.

- Compound Fracture: When bone tears split into bone shards after hitting an obstacle or enemy, the bone shards will split into 4 smaller bone shards after hitting the ground.

- Ipecac/Fire Mind: Main tear splits into four explosive splash tears. The split tears can still damage Isaac. Having Host Hat or Pyromaniac is strongly recommended.

- Technology: The sprinkler fires lasers instead of tears.
- Tiny Planet: Tears will travel toward and orbit Isaac, wherever he is in the room.

- Box of Friends: The copy of Lil Delirium will be a different random familiar.
- Car Battery: Makes two items free upon use.

- Anti-Gravity: All of the tears fired are connected by electricity, creating a series of electric fences.
- Apple! / Tough Love: The damage of the electricity can be multiplied by the items. This occurs independently from the tears which generated the electricity.
- Apple! / Tough Love: The damage of the electricity can be multiplied by the items. This occurs independently from the tears which generated the electricity.

- Cricket's Body / Compound Fracture / The Parasite: Split tears will be connected via electricity.

- Proptosis: Triples the electricity damage. Has no penalty with range.
- Sinus Infection: Boogers will have electricity flowing between them even if attached to the same enemy, dealing massive damage to bosses.
- Sulfuric Acid / Terra: The lasers are capable of destroying terrain, but is unable to apply knockback, allowing to easily destroy large quantities of obstacles.

- BFFS!: Increases Horsemens' size and doubles their contact damage. Does not affect locusts spawned.

- Hive Mind: Increases locusts' size and doubles their damage.

- Akeldama: Turns the chain of tears into four multi-colored chains.

- Anti-Gravity: Tears that are floating in the air when they hit the prism will quadruple but will not move. Tears that begin moving before they hit the prism will travel outwards normally.

 - With Flat Stone, split suspended tears will bounce in place until their duration ends.
- Immaculate Heart: The extra spectral tears share the same orbit as Angelic Prism, making them very easy to split.
- Jacob's Ladder: All of the split tears will be electrified. Also, electric arcs that pass through the prism will be split.
- The Ludovico Technique: While the tear is in contact with the prism, it will fire 4 additional tears in cardinal directions at Isaac's tear rate.
- Saturnus: Since the prism and the orbiting tears have the exact same orbital radius, orbiting tears will immediately be split into 28 multi-colored tears upon entering a room.
- Tractor Beam: Tears will split but continue stacked on top of each other along the tractor beam, essentially quadrupling the shot's damage.

- Anti-gravity: Tears will force each other out of the way if placed on top of another tear. Releasing the trigger button propels the tears in the direction Isaac was firing at the time before slowing down to a stop.

- Continuum: The tears will bump into each other, increasing in speed as they go through the room until they dissipate or hit an enemy.

- Immaculate Heart: Tears that orbit Isaac will be constantly moving and therefore will never disappear until they hit an enemy or Isaac leaves the room. Filling the orbit with enough tears can potentially cause a chaotic, vibrating ring of eyeballs enveloping Isaac as the tears constantly collide with one another.

- Ipecac: Tears do not arc and will instead shoot straight. They retain their explosive abilities on impact with enemies or obstacles, or when they eventually fall. Tears also do not explode when bouncing off of each other, which can be used to propel the high-powered tears to other enemies.
- Lead Pencil/Monstro's Lung: Removes the arcing effect from the tears, greatly increasing air time. The tight cluster the tears are shot in will cause unpredictable spread, however.

- My Reflection: Tears constantly swarm around Isaac, quickly filling the room.
- The Parasite: When tears hit an enemy, obstacle, or wall, they split into many smaller tears that have the same behavior as eyeball tears.

- Rubber Cement: Allows tears to never disappear when hitting enemies and objects, increasing the uptime of tears greatly.
 - '''Rubber Cement''' + '''A Lump Of Coal''': Tears continuously increase in size and damage as they bounce endlessly around the room. Eventually the damage can be enough to kill bosses in a single frame.

- E. Coli/Flush!: Enemies that die by being turned into poop do not disrupt the Death's List chain and clearing a room by turning all its enemies into poop still grants Isaac the Death's List reward.
