- Brimstone: Haemolacria has priority. +20 Tear Delay after Haemolacria tears down, instead of Brimstone tears down. The main tears burst into 4-7 brimstone beams instead of smaller tears. The beams deal 100% damage per tick.

- Lodestone: Magnetized enemies draw other enemies to them, greatly increasing the chance that spores spread to other enemies.
- Lost Contact: Stuck tears will block projectiles shot by attached enemies, crippling or even stopping their ability to shoot projectiles entirely.

- Brimstone: Gives a chance to shoot 1-3 additional Brimstone lasers in random directions.
 - '''Brimstone''' + '''Monstro's Lung''': Overrides the Monstro's Lung + Brimstone synergy.
- Epic Fetus: More marks appear orbiting around where you're aiming.
- Eye of the Occult: Control of all tears' direction means all of the extra shots still travel in the direction in which the fire button is held, providing a substantial increase in DPS.
- Monstro's Lung: Gives a chance to shoot 1-3 additional Monstro's Lung bursts in random directions.

- Tech X: Gives a chance to shoot 1-3 additional laser rings in the same general direction as the main laser ring. Extra rings randomly deviate by up to about 25 degrees from the main ring, and their size and damage also scale with the main one.
- Technology: Gives a chance to fire 1-3 additional lasers in random directions.
- Tiny Planet: The 1-3 additional tears orbit as Isaac's normal tears would, noticeably increasing damage.
- Abyss: When Isaac uses Abyss to absorb 120 Volt it turns into a pale blue locust. The locust can create arcs of electricity dealing 0.1 damage per tick.
- Camo Undies: Enemies won't target Isaac, thus he can safely zap enemies while standing near them. However, this won't work with bosses.
- Isaac's Heart: 120 Volt becomes much safer to use offensively as Isaac's body no longer takes damage.
- Pause: Zaps will not stop the pause effect allowing Isaac to kill or chip bosses easily by standing near them for the duration of the pause effect.
- Brimstone / Monstro's Lung / Tech X: Fires automatically upon reaching full charge. Tech X overrides the worm trinket effects.

- Adrenaline: Activates the damage up effect of Adrenaline for the resulting empty heart containers at the start of each floor.

- BFFS!: Adds 2 full hearts' worth of bonuses if any health is drained at all, e.g. losing 1 heart gives the bonuses of 3 hearts. This allows for up to 14 hearts' worth of bonuses.

- The Jar: Red hearts can be stored for use on the next floor.
- Placenta: With enough patience, health can be safely restored each floor by waiting in the starting room.
- Whore of Babylon: Activates the Whore of Babylon effect at the start of each floor.
- Aquarius: Each individual puddle will grant a different effect, and will copy the corresponding color.

- Crooked Penny / Diplopia: An extra item is spawned per each item cloned.
- dark arts: When in the shadow state, Isaac can survive the instant kill of Damocles, though this requires precise timing and can be impossible if Dark Art's charge is empty as the sword is falling.

- Gnawed Leaf: If in the form of the statue, Isaac will be immune to the falling sword.
 - Tooth and Nail's statue form can also save Isaac, but the statue transformation time lining up with the sword falling is unlikely.
- Magic Skin: Spawns 2 items on every use instead of 1.
- My Little Unicorn / Unicorn Stump / other items that give invulnerability: If active, will negate the sword's lethal fall, saving Isaac.
- My Little Unicorn / Unicorn Stump / other items that give invulnerability: If active, will negate the sword's lethal fall, saving Isaac.
- Mega Mush: When activated, protected from falling Damocles.
- BFFs!: Increases damage dealt by the familiars by 40%.
- The Common Cold / Ipecac: Minisaacs will be colored green but they will not get any benefits nor shoot out poison tears.
- The Common Cold / Ipecac: Minisaacs will be colored green but they will not get any benefits nor shoot out poison tears.
- Dull Razor: Provides a penalty-free way of spawning Minisaacs and/or healing existing ones.
- Sacrificial Altar: Converts all Minisaacs into 1 Penny each upon use.
- Terra: Makes Minisaacs grey.
- Contact damage items work great with Tooth and Nail, such as Aries / Mom's Heels / The Virus for extra damage, Serpent's Kiss for Black Heart generation, Midas' Touch for coin generation etc.
- Contact damage items work great with Tooth and Nail, such as Aries / Mom's Heels / The Virus for extra damage, Serpent's Kiss for Black Heart generation, Midas' Touch for coin generation etc.
- Contact damage items work great with Tooth and Nail, such as Aries / Mom's Heels / The Virus for extra damage, Serpent's Kiss for Black Heart generation, Midas' Touch for coin generation etc.
- Contact damage items work great with Tooth and Nail, such as Aries / Mom's Heels / The Virus for extra damage, Serpent's Kiss for Black Heart generation, Midas' Touch for coin generation etc.
- Contact damage items work great with Tooth and Nail, such as Aries / Mom's Heels / The Virus for extra damage, Serpent's Kiss for Black Heart generation, Midas' Touch for coin generation etc.
- Damocles: As Isaac is invincible 1/6th of the time, with some luck, Tooth and Nail may save him from the falling sword.
- Kamikaze!: Allows usage without taking damage during invincibility.

- {{C|The Lost}} can use this item to prevent additional damage from occurring after losing the Holy Mantle (for example, exiting a Curse Room after being hit), and it does not use up the Holy Mantle's 1-hit protection if it has not been lost.
- Birthright: If Keeper is the one picking it up, it will grant him a heart container.
- Crooked Penny / Diplopia: Picking up multiple copies of the item will spawn additional Keepers that each have their own inventory.
- Crooked Penny / Diplopia: Picking up multiple copies of the item will spawn additional Keepers that each have their own inventory.
- Greed's Gullet: Keeper gains extra coin hearts at every 25 coin interval.
- More Options / There's Options: With careful positioning, both item choice pedestals can be taken.
- More Options / There's Options: With careful positioning, both item choice pedestals can be taken.

- The Polaroid / The Negative: Keeper can take the other photo not chosen by Isaac. Keeper will not directly benefit from holding the Polaroid, but the Negative will give him a damage up. Keeper can use his photo to open A Strange Door, allowing Isaac to keep his. If intending to go to Chest or Dark Room, note that the photo held by Keeper will be lost if he dies.

- The Polaroid / The Negative: Keeper can take the other photo not chosen by Isaac. Keeper will not directly benefit from holding the Polaroid, but the Negative will give him a damage up. Keeper can use his photo to open A Strange Door, allowing Isaac to keep his. If intending to go to Chest or Dark Room, note that the photo held by Keeper will be lost if he dies.
- Sanguine Bond: A very beneficial item for both Isaac and Keeper, as it is fairly easy to snowball into infinitely playing the spikes.
- Yum Heart: Because of how Yum Heart works in co-op, when Isaac uses Yum Heart, it will also restore one coin heart for Keeper.
- Bag of Crafting: Both rewards can be collected in one scoop, although somewhat inconsistently.

- Contract From Below: Spawns a second set of consumables. The "Options?" consumable is not guaranteed to be the same for each copy of the original consumable. Each pair of consumables functions independently for "Options?" meaning Isaac can pick up one of the first two rewards and one of the second two rewards.
- Deep Pockets: If multiple coins are generated, each one will have its own alternative reward.
- Guppy's Eye: Takes the guesswork out of choosing between a chest/sack and a pickup by allowing you to see what the chest/sack will give.
- Guppy's Tail: Gives a choice between a golden chest and something else in case you are low on keys.

- Magneto: Opening a chest does not make the other reward disappear. Picking up the other reward afterwards will only remove the empty chest, and picking up the contents of the chest will not make the other reward disappear, letting Isaac take both rewards. This does not apply to chests with items in them, which disappear or make the other reward disappear as normal. Touching a chest will still make the other reward disappear.
- Hypercoagulation:/{{C|Tainted Magdalene}}: Can provide infinite stat boosts, if the dropped hearts are caught in time.
- Maggy's Bow: Increases the stat boosts given by Candy Heart, provided extra Red health was restored.
- Binge Eater: All shops become free stat-ups if the food item is chosen.

- Restock: The price never increases, staying at one red heart container/three soul hearts for each item, and one full heart of damage for pickups.
 - However, Restock's coin cost increase mechanic is still present, and if Pound of Flesh is lost, the items will have their equivalent coin cost displayed.
 - With Binge Eater, this can result in infinite stat gains.
 - If a Heart is on sale, Isaac can trigger :Category:Damage-triggered items|items that activate upon taking damage indefinitely.
 - If a Lil' Battery is on sale, Isaac can buy items indefinitely with certain active items such as Blank Card with XI - Strength or Book of Revelations with Car Battery.
 - When transformed into a ghost in Downpour II, or playing as{{C|The Lost}}, Isaac can buy items indefinitely.
- Maggy's Bow: Buying a Red Heart will out-heal the damage taken from the spikes if Isaac can survive it.

- The Wafer / Cancer / Pills#Pill Effects|Percs!: The spikes only deal half a heart damage, allowing Isaac to gain health from buying hearts.
 - With Restock, any character except {{C|Bethany}} can buy items indefinitely if a Soul Heart is on sale.

- The Wafer / Cancer / Pills#Pill Effects|Percs!: The spikes only deal half a heart damage, allowing Isaac to gain health from buying hearts.
 - With Restock, any character except {{C|Bethany}} can buy items indefinitely if a Soul Heart is on sale.

- Glowing Hour Glass: +1 damage up and soul heart given by Redemption will persist after time leap to the upper floor if Glowing Hour Glass used before Redemption finishes its animation, as well as giving another activated Redemption after time leap. This will allow to take Redemption's damage buff and soul hearts several times per floor. However, if you can use Glowing Hour Glass two times in a row, in order to get damage up and soul heart second time, you'll need to leave the boss room before going down the floor second time.
- {{C|The Lost}}: Effectively acts as a rechargeable extra life, granting additional defensive measures on top of his inherent Holy Mantle and granting a use to normally useless Soul Hearts.
- Magic Skin: When all hearts are converted to Health#Broken Hearts|Broken Hearts, Isaac will be revived with half a soul heart, allowing many more uses with low health.
- Guppy's Paw: The heart containers granted by Empty Heart can be used by Guppy's Paw while staying at or below 1 red heart, granting massively increased survivability.
- Potato Peeler: The heart containers granted by Empty Heart can be used by Potato Peeler while staying at or below 1 red heart, granting increased damage and a Cube of Meat per floor.
- Potato Peeler: The heart containers granted by Empty Heart can be used by Potato Peeler while staying at or below 1 red heart, granting increased damage and a Cube of Meat per floor.
- Dark Prince's Crown: The heart containers are empty when granted, which allows the crown's buff to stay active when advancing floors.
- Hypercoagulation: Due to the effective speed up, the heart used to activate Astral Projection can easily be collected before it disappears.

- Old Bandage: When getting hit with only one heart left, Astral Projection allows for picking up the dropped heart in the brief time of invincibility even when the player has no hearts left. Failing to do so or having no hearts dropped results in guaranteed death however, but with luck this loop can be used to potentially save runs.
- Berserk!: Isaac can fire the fetuses on duration. The fetuses hold and attack with bone clubs that are identical to {{C|The Forgotten}}'s one.

- Brimstone / {{c|Azazel}}: Shoots 4 fetus tears along with the brimstone beam.
 - Each additional beams created from Monstro's Lung or The Parasite, multi-shot effects including Loki's Horns, Eye Sore spawns four additional fetuses.
 - Anti-Gravity: The fetuses spawn when the beam is being released. The fetuses do not spawn if Isaac is charging when the beam is being released.
 - The Ludovico Technique: When combined with Brimstone, overrides C Section: fetuses no longer spawn.
- Compound Fracture: Fetuses are skeletons that shoot splitting bone fragments when in contact with an enemy.
- Cricket's Body: Fetuses drop four short-ranged tears when they hit the ground.

- Dead Eye: Damage boost is granted once a fetus hits an enemy (once per fetus) and is reset when a fetus does not hit anything before going down, using the same rule to determine whether the damage boost is reset or not.
 - This makes for a great synergy since the fetuses are homing and stay up much longer than regular tears.

- Dr. Fetus: The fetuses drop small bombs when they touch an enemy. The bomb's damage follows Dr. Fetus' damage calculation, based on half of the fetuses damage. A fetus can drop only one bomb.
 - The fetuses' bombs do not benefit from Isaac's bomb effects such as Hot Bombs or Bobby-Bomb. However, they do benefit from Isaac's tear effects and have appearance of the corresponding bombs. For example, Hot Bombs from Fire Mind, Bobby-Bomb from Tear Effects|Homing Tears. As such, Cricket's Body, The Parasite and Polyphemus leave a subsequent bomb or bombs, and Mysterious Liquid leaves a creep.
 - Dr. Fetus + Ipecac: The fetuses explode before dropping any bomb.
 - Dr. Fetus + Haemolacria: Fetuses will both drop a bomb on touching an enemy and burst into multiple small bombs upon hitting the ground.

- Explosivo: Some Fetuses stick to enemies, expand then explode. However, they do not inflict their contact damage while sticking.
 - Explosivo + Mom's Knife: The knives from fetuses with Explosivo's effect create exploding tears for each damaging tick. The explosions from a knife deal 60 + half of the fetus' damage which held it.
 - Explosivo + Berserk! / Spirit Sword / {{C|The Forgotten}} / {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The clubs/swords from fetuses with Explosivo's effect create exploding tears for each damaged enemy from their attack. The explosions from a club/sword deal 60 + the damage its attack dealt.
 - Explosivo + Technology: The lasers from fetuses with Explosivo's effect create exploding tears for each damaged enemy from their attack. The tears inherit the fetuses' property including laser attacks, which can create another tears. The tears from a laser deal 60 + the laser's damage they originated, and their lasers deal the same as the lasers they originated. Fetuses can fire lasers while sticking to an enemy and spin, while tears do not spin.
 - Explosivo + Tech X: The laser rings from fetuses with Explosivo's effect create exploding tears for each damaging tick. The explosions from a ring deal 60 + the ring's damage.
- Godhead: Fetuses have a glowing aura around them, but the aura cannot damage the enemy in contact with the fetuses.
- Haemolacria: Fetuses explode into a burst of tears when they hit the ground.
- Ipecac: The fetuses explode on impact dealing its contact damage, which is often massively increased from the item.
- Jacob's Ladder: Fetuses zap nearby enemies.

- Luck-based tear effects (e.g. Holy Light / Knockout Drops): If a fetus has the effect, the fetus cause the effect for each damaging tick.
 - Little Horn: Still only two hands can appear at once.
 - Ocular Rift: The rifts spawn only once per fetus.
 - Luck-based tear effects + Mom's Knife: If a fetus has the effect, the knife also causes the effect for each damaging tick. If not, the knife has chance to cause the effect based on Isaac's Luck for each damaging tick.
 - Luck-based tear effects + Berserk! / Spirit Sword / Technology / {{C|The Forgotten}} / {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: If a fetus has the effect, each attack also causes the effect.
 - Luck-based tear effects + Tech X: If a fetus has the effect, the laser ring also causes the effect for each damaging tick.

- Luck-based tear effects (e.g. Holy Light / Knockout Drops): If a fetus has the effect, the fetus cause the effect for each damaging tick.
 - Little Horn: Still only two hands can appear at once.
 - Ocular Rift: The rifts spawn only once per fetus.
 - Luck-based tear effects + Mom's Knife: If a fetus has the effect, the knife also causes the effect for each damaging tick. If not, the knife has chance to cause the effect based on Isaac's Luck for each damaging tick.
 - Luck-based tear effects + Berserk! / Spirit Sword / Technology / {{C|The Forgotten}} / {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: If a fetus has the effect, each attack also causes the effect.
 - Luck-based tear effects + Tech X: If a fetus has the effect, the laser ring also causes the effect for each damaging tick.

- Mom's Knife: Fetuses hold small knives in their front, causing extra damage. The knife deals twice of Isaac's Damage just as when it is held by Isaac and their size scales with the fetuses' size. Any additional copy of the item causes Isaac to shoot more fetuses.
 - Mom's Knife + Proptosis: The knives shrink along with the fetuses, but they retain their tripled damage.
 - Mom's Knife + Brimstone: Instead of a barrage of knives, fires a normal Brimstone beam alongside knife-carrying fetuses.

- Mucormycosis: Some Fetuses stick to enemies, expand then burst. However, they do not inflict their contact damage while sticking. Unlike normal spores, the fetuses from the burst can home into the enemy they burst from.
 - Mucormycosis + Mom's Knife: The knives from fetuses with Mucormycosis' effect create spores for each damaging tick. Their knives deal twice of Isaac's Damage, same as the ones they originated.
 - Mucormycosis + Berserk! / Spirit Sword / {{C|The Forgotten}} / {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The clubs/swords from fetuses with Mucormycosis' effect create spores for each damaged enemy from their attack. The fetuses from the burst also hold clubs/swords which are able to create another wave of spores. The damage of attacks are calculated based on half of the spores' flat 3.5 damage.
  - Berserk! / {{C|The Forgotten}}: Their swings deal 10.5 damage.
  - {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: Their swings deal 8.4 damage.
  - Spirit Sword: Their swing attacks/spin attacks/projectiles deal 8.75/24/11 damage.
 - Mucormycosis + Technology: The lasers from fetuses with Mucormycosis' effect create spores for each damaged enemy from their attack. The spores inherit the fetuses' property including laser attacks, which can create another spores. The fetuses from the burst also has laser attacks which are able to create another wave of spores. Their laser attacks deal 3.5 damage, based on the spores' flat 3.5 damage. Fetuses can fire lasers while sticking to an enemy and spin, while spores do not spin.
 - Mucormycosis + Tech X: The laser rings from fetuses with Mucormycosis' effect create spores for each damaging tick. The fetuses from the burst are also surrounded by laser rings which are able to create another wave of spores. Their rings deal 1.75 damage, based on half of the spores' flat 3.5 damage.
- My Reflection: Fetuses travel a short distance, then reverse direction and return to Isaac.
- The Parasite: Fetuses fire short-ranged tears constantly while in contact with an enemy.
- Parasitoid: Parasitoid fetuses spawn spiders/flies and slowing creep with every hit on an enemy.
- Polyphemus: Grants +5 flat damage with no fire rate down.

- Sinus Infection: Some Fetuses stick to enemies. However, they only do the Sinus Infection damage ticking and often result in dealing much less damage.
 - Sinus Infection + Mom's Knife: The knives from fetuses Sinus Infection's effect create boogers for each damaging tick. The boogers from a knife deal half of the fetus' damage which held it per tick.
 - Sinus Infection + Berserk! / Spirit Sword / {{C|The Forgotten}} / {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The clubs/swords from fetuses with Sinus Infection's effect create boogers for each damaged enemy from their attack. The boogers from a club/sword deal half of the fetus' damage which held it per tick.
 - Sinus Infection + Technology: The lasers from fetuses with Sinus Infection's effect create boogers for each damaged enemy from their attack. The boogers inherit the fetuses' property including laser attacks, which can create another boogers. The boogers from a laser deal the laser's damage, so does their lasers. Fetuses can fire lasers while sticking to an enemy and spin, while boogers do not spin.
 - Sinus Infection + Tech X: The laser rings from fetuses Sinus Infection's effect create boogers for each damaging tick. The boogers from a ring deal the ring's damage per tick.

- Spirit Sword: Fetuses hold small swords and repeat the swing attack and the charged spin attack as they travel. The damage calculation is based on half of the fetus' damage. On base Range, they have just enough time to perform the attacks twice. The sword's size scales with the fetus' size.
 - Spirit Sword + Berserk! / Mom's Knife / {{C|The Forgotten}} / {{C|Tainted Forgotten}}: The fetuses hold swords and do not benefit from the others.
 - Spirit Sword + Proptosis: Although the attacks' damages diminish along with the fetus, the projectile from the sword does not lose its damage over range.
- Tech.5 / Technology 2: Both fire at the same time.
- Tech.5 / Technology 2: Both fire at the same time.
- Technology Zero: Fetuses are connected with electricity.

- Tech X: Fetuses are surrounded by a laser ring that deals half of their damage. The ring's size scales with the fetus' size.
 - Tech X + Brimstone: The laser rings do not change into brimstone rings. The Brimstone has no effect unless combined with other additional items.
 - Tech X + Proptosis: The rings shrink along with the fetuses, but they retain their tripled damage.

- Technology: Fetuses rapidly shoot a short-ranged laser based on their damage when facing enemies.
 - Technology + Cricket's Body: Split tears created from the end of the laser inherit the effects of fetus tears including laser attacks from Technology, but they do not create another split tears.
 - Technology + Lachryphagy: Fetuses can feed on either other fetuses or Lachryphagy tears which their laser attacks create. Fed fetuses shoot stronger lasers, creating powerful Lachryphagy tears.
 - Technology + Pop!: Pop! tears created from the end of the laser inherit the effects of fetus tears including laser attacks from Technology, which can create another Pop! tears.
 - Technology + Proptosis: Although the laser's damage diminishes along with the fetus, it does not lose its damage over range.
 - Technology + Spirit Sword: Fetuses hold lightsabers and perform laser attacks and enhanced sword attacks separately, causing more damage.
- Dark Arts: The corn Isaac poops out can be sliced, giving Isaac an insane damage up in seconds.

- Hemoptysis: Enemies hit by the sneeze will gain a curse that increases the damage the poop beam deals to 2x and +3 flat damage. Enemies who die to the poop beam under the curse will damage and spread the curse to nearby enemies.
- Ipecac: The poop beam will unleash a barrage of explosions at the end of it.
- Lachryphagy: Spawns a large amount of tears at the end of the poop beam, heavily increasing Isaac's damage output.

- My Reflection: Causes the poop beam range behind Isaac to become significantly increased as well as having a short range similar to Azazel's beam in front of him. This greatly eases the use of this item allowing for high DPS.
- The Parasite: The poop beam splits into two horizontal beams meaning less risk for Isaac and a bigger area for enemies to be hit.
- Eye of the Occult: Makes the poop beam fire towards the crosshair, extending the possible range of the beam.
- BFFS!: Doubles the bones' size and damage.
- Spin to Win: Boosts the bones' damage while spinning even though there's no visual tell of the effect.
- Aries: Retains the chance to bounce enemies while preventing damage simultaneously.
- Book of Shadows / Unicorn Stump: Can be used as a powerful offensive item since Isaac can still bounce off enemies while invincible.
- Book of Shadows / Unicorn Stump: Can be used as a powerful offensive item since Isaac can still bounce off enemies while invincible.
- Cone Head / Host Hat / Infamy: Offers an additional chance to negate damage.
- Cone Head / Host Hat / Infamy: Offers an additional chance to negate damage.
- Cone Head / Host Hat / Infamy: Offers an additional chance to negate damage.
- Gnawed Leaf: The bouncing effect works while Isaac is invincible.
- Serpent's Kiss: Allows Isaac to bounce enemies and poison them at the same time, with a decent chance to get a lot more health back in the form of Black Hearts than originally spent.

- Goat Head + Scapular: The spikes generated by Sanguine Bond can be farmed infinitely.
 - Quitting and reloading the game will also reset the soul heart regeneration provided by Scapular, thus negating the need for Goat Head

- Goat Head + Scapular: The spikes generated by Sanguine Bond can be farmed infinitely.
 - Quitting and reloading the game will also reset the soul heart regeneration provided by Scapular, thus negating the need for Goat Head
- {{c|Keeper}} / {{c|Tainted Keeper}} / Strawman: The pennies that are spawned when stepping on the spikes can be used to heal Keeper and infinitely farm rewards.
- Placenta: With a lot of time, the spikes can be farmed infinitely.
- Portable slot: The pennies that are spawned can be gambled to give hearts, allowing more uses.
- The wafer / Pills|Percs: Hearts will last twice as long, allowing more uses. Further uses may be obtained by sacrificing the black hearts given, and any hearts added from devil room items.
- Gnawed Leaf: The light beams trigger even when Isaac is a statue.

- Sacrificial Altar: The twin can be sacrificed normally at any time.
 - If sacrificed after it's transformed into a boss, it will still give an item from the sacrifice, but the boss will not disappear and will also ''not'' spawn an additional item.

- Satanic Bible: Using it before killing the clone boss will cause it to spawn an item from the Devil Room (Item Pool)|Devil Room item pool instead of from the Boss (Item Pool)|Boss item pool. This item must be purchased just like a normal Devil Room#Deals with the Devil|Devil Deal.
- There's Options: Will spawn an additional item choice for the item spawned by Vanishing Twin.

- Vanishing Twin: Picking up multiple copies of the item will result in multiple clones getting spawned.
 - Each boss will have its health reduced down further to 75% of the health of its previous clone.
 - Each of the bosses will spawn a separate item.
 - Each clone of Great Gideon adds 2 extra waves of enemies.
- BFFS!: Twisted Pair's tears deal twice as much damage.
- Box of Friends/Crooked Penny/Diplopia: Each additional Twisted Pair will add two more familiars that float farther out from Isaac.
- Box of Friends/Crooked Penny/Diplopia: Each additional Twisted Pair will add two more familiars that float farther out from Isaac.
- Box of Friends/Crooked Penny/Diplopia: Each additional Twisted Pair will add two more familiars that float farther out from Isaac.
- Tractor Beam: Twisted Pair's tears follow the beam.

- ? Card + Ancient Recall / Pills#Pill Effects|Vurp Pill + R Key: The ? Card effect can be used in conjunction with R Key without consuming it, allowing the player to in theory (with the help of Clicker) obtain completion marks for up to four additional routes and characters in a single run.

- ? Card + Ancient Recall / Pills#Pill Effects|Vurp Pill + R Key: The ? Card effect can be used in conjunction with R Key without consuming it, allowing the player to in theory (with the help of Clicker) obtain completion marks for up to four additional routes and characters in a single run.

- False PHD: Taking benign pills (e.g. puberty) will give black hearts or damage ups for each of the pills that are activated. Caution should be exercised when using this synergy, since the last three pills taken will be converted to their bad counterparts, and one stat down can ruin the synergy.
- PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r: The last three activated pills are converted to their good counterparts, including pills taken prior to picking up PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r.
- PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r: The last three activated pills are converted to their good counterparts, including pills taken prior to picking up PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r.
- PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r: The last three activated pills are converted to their good counterparts, including pills taken prior to picking up PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r.
- PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r: The last three activated pills are converted to their good counterparts, including pills taken prior to picking up PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r.
- PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r: The last three activated pills are converted to their good counterparts, including pills taken prior to picking up PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r.
- PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r: The last three activated pills are converted to their good counterparts, including pills taken prior to picking up PHD, Virgo, or Lucky Foot|r.
- R Key: Using the R key does not reset the consumable pool, as such they stay the same in Echo Chamber too.
- Suicide King + Dead Cat: Can be used to generate many pickups and items at the cost of three extra lives.
- Tarot Cloth: Every activated tarot card will be given a bonus effect.
- BFFS!: Doubles the wisps' size, on-hit and contact damage.
- Blood Oath: For each half heart of damage taken at the start of the room, a wisp is spawned.
- D12: Due to the high tendency of replacing rocks with TNT, it allows for easy destruction of nearby rocks, resulting in lots of blue spiders.
- Leo / Thunder Thighs: As Isaac can break all reachable rocks, he can amass a lot of blue spiders.
- Leo / Thunder Thighs: As Isaac can break all reachable rocks, he can amass a lot of blue spiders.
- Blood Rights / Razor Blade: Damage taken to use the item also spawns hearts, reducing the cost of using them.
- Blood Rights / Razor Blade: Damage taken to use the item also spawns hearts, reducing the cost of using them.
- Cancer / Pills|Percs! pill / The Wafer: Damage sources that spawn full red hearts will still spawn a full red heart despite the cost being reduced to half a heart.
- Cancer / Pills|Percs! pill / The Wafer: Damage sources that spawn full red hearts will still spawn a full red heart despite the cost being reduced to half a heart.
- Candy Heart / Immaculate Conception: The hearts will count toward gaining stat boosts/familiars.
- Candy Heart / Immaculate Conception: The hearts will count toward gaining stat boosts/familiars.
- Dull Razor: Can be used to spawn full red hearts for Isaac to pick up. Ideally, this should be done in a confined space so Isaac can easily pick up the heart.
- Maggy's Bow: Doubles the healing received from the hearts spawned.
- Magneto / {{t|Super Magnet}}: Will immediately start pulling the dropped hearts to Isaac, breaking their momentum and making collection much easier.
- Fire Mind: The sneeze will still set enemies on Status Effects#Burn|fire, but not cause explosions, similar to its interaction with Brimstone.
- Fire Mind: The sneeze will still set enemies on Status Effects#Burn|fire, but not cause explosions, similar to its interaction with Brimstone.
- Loki's Horns: Chance to sneeze in all cardinal directions.
- Lost Contact: The sneeze reflects enemy shots.
- Monstro's Lung: Multiple sneezes are applied around the character.
- The Wiz: Shoots two sneezes diagonally instead of one straight forward.
- Dr. Fetus: Has a chance to shoot a Ghost Bomb that also has spectral properties and can travel through objects.
- Scatter Bombs: Split bombs create ghosts that instantly launch themselves at enemies and explode, similar to Purgatory. They each deal 2x Isaac's damage, up to 4 times.
- Scatter Bombs: Split bombs create ghosts that instantly launch themselves at enemies and explode, similar to Purgatory. They each deal 2x Isaac's damage, up to 4 times.
- Mr. Mega: Ghosts appear larger and do extra damage only upon exploding.
- Deep Pockets: The increased money capacity can allow the Golden Razor to be used more than 10 times as much before the player runs out of money.
- Rock Bottom: The damage bonus from each use will be permanently locked at the highest achieved value in a single room.
- 4.5 Volt: Allows for repeated usage of Sulfur in one room.
- Brimstone/Car Battery: Activates twice to give an additional damage bonus and wider laser.
- Brimstone/Car Battery: Activates twice to give an additional damage bonus and wider laser.
- {{t|Broken glasses}} / {{t|Devil's Crown}} / More Options / {{t|Pay to Win}}: Affects Red Treasure Rooms.
- Glowing hour glass: Rewinding out of a Red Room and creating it again in the same place will generate a new one, potentially a better one.
- {{t|Judas' Tongue}} / {{t|Keeper's Bargain}} / {{t|Number Magnet}} / A Pound of Flesh / Sanguine Bond: Affects Red Devil Rooms.
- {{t|Judas' Tongue}} / {{t|Keeper's Bargain}} / {{t|Number Magnet}} / A Pound of Flesh / Sanguine Bond: Affects Red Devil Rooms.
- Luna: Affects Red Secret Rooms and Super Secret Rooms.
- Mama Mega!: Will trigger its effect in new Red Rooms, provided it has already been used on the floor.
- Spelunker Hat: Instantly reveals the Ultra Secret Room if it is adjacent to the Red Room created.

- Rock Bottom: The distortion effect will wear off eventually, but the highest reached fire rate bonus won't. However, Wavy Cap will no longer have any positive effects until an even higher bonus is reached.

- glowing hour glass + schoolbag: Using Glowing Hour Glass before the Alabaster Box opening animation is complete will return the box to you while still opening it, allowing for infinite uses of Alabaster Box.

- glowing hour glass + schoolbag: Using Glowing Hour Glass before the Alabaster Box opening animation is complete will return the box to you while still opening it, allowing for infinite uses of Alabaster Box.

- Guppy's Paw + Schoolbag: Heart containers converted to Soul Hearts contribute to Alabaster Box's charge instead of being added to Isaac's health. This enables a full charge for just two heart containers.

- Guppy's Paw + Schoolbag: Heart containers converted to Soul Hearts contribute to Alabaster Box's charge instead of being added to Isaac's health. This enables a full charge for just two heart containers.
- Void: Can activate Alabaster Box without consuming Soul Hearts. The effect is only used by Void once.

- Cube Baby can be picked up and thrown by using the braclet while trying to kick the Cube Baby. When thrown, Cube Baby deals around the amount of damage as a higher speed kick, but it will also leave the creep that a frozen enemy would create when kicked.
- The Battery: Larynx can hold up to two full charges. Only up to 12 charges will be used at a time.
- Habit: Both on-hit charge effects stack, charging 2 points per hit.
- Continuum: Thrown keys can unlock doors they pass through after looping around the screen.
- Mom's Key: Doubles the amount of pickups dropped by enemies.

- Angelic Prism: A thrown key will duplicate into 4 keys, which can be used to open multiple rooms or chests with only 1 key. If Isaac stands at the middle far left or middle far right of the first room in Chest, a thrown key can open all 4 chests.
- 4.5 Volt: The contact damage dealt by Mega Mush will allow it to be recharged and used multiple times in the same room.
- Car Battery: Mega Mush's active time will be doubled to 60 seconds.
- Diplopia: Has no use inside of the Home area, as Isaac can only take 1 item. However, it can be used to duplicate the Death Certificate item, allowing Isaac to enter the area twice.

- Schoolbag: Allows Isaac to hold another Active item into the area along with Death Certificate.
 - Void / Abyss / Black Rune: Allows the consumption of items without forcing Isaac to leave the area.
 - Moving Box: Allows an additional 10 items to be taken without forcing Isaac to leave the area.
- Lusty Blood: Each split enemy killed grants a damage boost.
- 9 Volt: Halves Stitches' charge time.
- BFFS!: On teleport, fires 8 tears outwards at Isaac's original location. The tears synergize with Isaac's tear effects.
- Serpent's Kiss / The Virus: Can poison enemies during the brief immunity granted after teleporting.
- Serpent's Kiss / The Virus: Can poison enemies during the brief immunity granted after teleporting.
- Angelic Prism: Throwing the Eraser through the Angelic Prism will cause it to split into four.
- The Battery: The eraser can gain an extra charge if it is not used on one floor.

- Blood Puppy: Throwing the Eraser at an enraged Blood Puppy (second stage) will 'erase' its enraged form, keeping it permanently tame.
 - Throwing the Eraser at its third stage will make it cycle through its normal and second stage as it kills enemies.
- Glowing Hour Glass: Using Glowing Hour Glass to return to the previous floor will keep the charge Eraser received from entering the next floor.
- Void: An eraser can be thrown with each use of Void after absorbing it, allowing multiple uses per floor.
- Angelic Prism: Flames can be split into four multi-colored flames.
- Bird's Eye / Ghost Pepper: The urn can emit flames from these items. Ghost Pepper flames are indistinguishable from Urn of Souls flames, but persist on the ground for longer.
- Bird's Eye / Ghost Pepper: The urn can emit flames from these items. Ghost Pepper flames are indistinguishable from Urn of Souls flames, but persist on the ground for longer.
- Immaculate Heart: Each individual flame has a chance to cause Immaculate Heart to generate an orbiting tear.
- Lead Pencil: Every 15 flames shot out of the urn will shoot a barrage of Isaac's tears.
- Multidimensional Baby: All flames shot through Multidimensional Baby are doubled, providing a burst of flashing black-and-white tears.
- Eye of Greed: Golden tears from Eye of Greed will shoot as normal while using the urn.

- Car Battery: Spawns 2 items and adds 2 broken hearts (removing 2 heart containers or 4 soul hearts) with each use. Two broken hearts are added regardless of Isaac's remaining health. If Isaac already has 11 broken hearts and uses Magic Skin, it will only be used once.
- Damocles: Spawns 2 items on every use instead of 1.
- Dream Catcher: If Magic Skin has replaced the item in the Treasure Room, it will be shown in the dream sequence.

- Esau Jr.: Since Esau Jr.'s health is separate from Isaac's, one character can use Magic Skin at no cost to the other. Future items will still be replaced when playing as the character that hasn't used Magic Skin.
- Schoolbag: Isaac can keep Magic Skin in the inactive slot to prevent its respawning while still being able to use another active item.

- Spindown Dice: Using Spindown Dice on Magic Skin 6 times turns it into R Key.
 - '''Spindown Dice''' + '''Schoolbag''': Allows Isaac to keep Spindown Dice between runs, allowing a theoretically infinite run with enough luck.

- Spindown Dice: Using Spindown Dice on Magic Skin 6 times turns it into R Key.
 - '''Spindown Dice''' + '''Schoolbag''': Allows Isaac to keep Spindown Dice between runs, allowing a theoretically infinite run with enough luck.
- Angelic Prism: Baby Plum's shots that pass through the Prism will be split into four.
- Car Battery: Summons two Baby Plums, the Baby Plums start out overlapped but can sometimes split up when using different attacks.
- Sacrificial Altar: Baby Plum can be sacrificed for free, instead of a familiar. Plum Flute can still be used as normal afterwards.
- Gnawed Leaf: Gnawed Leaf will activate while using Spin to Win, as long as Isaac is stationary. This allows for a brief moment of high damage against enemies that chase Isaac.
- Taurus: Spin to Win's speed boost instantly triggers the item's invincibility effect.

- Pluto: The exceedingly high speed and small hitbox enables Isaac to clip into obstacles such as rocks or pits, allowing him to effectively fly over them. Requires a running start, so Isaac can potentially get stuck, requiring a reload of the save.

- Suplex!: When used near the end of the Berserk state (any time after the second bell ring), Suplex receives a unique visual effect, and will deal massive damage to the target, while setting off a Mama Mega! style explosion, destroying all Obstacle|obstacles in the current room and blowing open all doors. The target being Suplexed, as well as nearby enemies, will receive 300 base damage that scales with Isaac's size. All other enemies receive 200 flat damage.

The target being Suplexed, as well as nearby enemies, will receive 300 base damage that scales with Isaac's size. All other enemies receive 200 flat damage.

- The Ludovico Technique: While under the Berserk state, you lose control of the Ludovico Technique tear, which can now be deflected by the jaw bone swing, bouncing off nearby walls and dealing damage to enemies.
- 120 Volt/Monstrance: These items stay in effect even while using Dark Arts, allowing Isaac to deal more damage to nearby enemies while invulnerable.
- 120 Volt/Monstrance: These items stay in effect even while using Dark Arts, allowing Isaac to deal more damage to nearby enemies while invulnerable.
- Aquarius: Due to the nature of Dark Arts, Isaac can easily damage enemies with the trail left behind.
- Backstabber: Tagging an enemy from behind will apply Backstabber's effect.
- Camo Undies: If used at the start of a room, after Dark Arts' effect ends, Isaac re-enters the stealth mode given by Camo Undies.
- Car Battery: Dark Arts will last twice as long, totaling at 2 seconds per use. If Dark Arts is ended early, a second Dark Arts will activate for the time remaining.
- Euthanasia: When Dark Arts ends, each enemy tagged may instantly die and release a burst of black tears as if hit by a Euthanasia tear.
- Gnawed Leaf: If Isaac is stationary when Dark Arts ends, he will gain invulnerability without any downtime. Dark Arts can also be used from invulnerability without taking damage.
- How To Jump: Jumping over an enemy or projectile while Dark Arts is active will tag it.
- Ipecac: Because Dark Arts' damage is scaled off of tear damage, Ipecac gives an extremely high damage boost to each Dark Arts hit, easily capable of destroying some early bosses in a single hit.
- Kamikaze!: Kamikaze! can be activated without harm when using Dark Arts.
- Mars: Isaac is able to dash while using Dark Arts, allowing him to reach more enemies in one use of Dark Arts while still dealing damage with Mars' dash.
- Mom's Knife: Mom's Knife will still deal damage even while in Dark Arts, killing most weaker enemies and bosses easily.

- Montezuma's Revenge: The corns created by Montezuma's Revenge can be caught by Dark Arts, and most will naturally, making each cast of Dark Arts give huge boosts of damage. The Brimstone beam created will also still be active while Dark Arts is active.

- Pause: Activating Dark Arts will not cancel the effect, turning Pause into an instant room clear in most situations and an effective tool for damaging bosses.
 - Pause + 4.5 Volt: Pause becomes an even more effective tool against bosses, as it can now be activated several times in the fight.
 - Pause + 9 Volt: Pause can be used every room, making most of them very easy to clear.
- Rock Bottom: Rock Bottom will prevent the damage bonus given to Tainted Judas or Dark Judas from decreasing, allowing him to keep the highest achieved damage bonus.
- Taurus: Dark Arts' damage bonus will contribute towards Taurus' activation, allowing Isaac to become invulnerable much earlier.

- BFFs! / Hive Mind: Increases the locusts' size and damage by 25%.
 - These two items don't stack.

- Wooden Nickel: ''~40%'' of the time you generate a random pickup.
 - 4.5 Volt: Generate random pickups over the course of a fight.

- Blank Card: Allows you to utilize card effects that synergize with this trinket multiple times.
 - IX - The Hermit?: Pickups / Items are sold and turned into other random pickups and only recharges after 1 room, often breaking the game.
 - XIV - Temperance: The generated machine now drops random pickups.
 - Ace of Diamonds / Ace of Spades: Re-rolls pickups in the room into other random pickups or turns enemies into random pickups.
 - XII - The Hanged Man?: Slain enemies drop random pickups.
 - A Card Against Humanity: Coins dropped by generated poops become random pickups.
  - Midas' Touch / {{T|Petrified Poop}}: Greatly increases the amount of coins and thus the amount of random pickups.

- IV bag / Piggy Bank / {{T|Swallowed Penny}}: Convert health into random pickups.
 - Gimpy / Old Bandage / Fanny pack: Further increase the chance of hearts appearing after use allowing the generation of even more random pickups.

- IV bag / Piggy Bank / {{T|Swallowed Penny}}: Convert health into random pickups.
 - Gimpy / Old Bandage / Fanny pack: Further increase the chance of hearts appearing after use allowing the generation of even more random pickups.

- Guppy's Tail: The keys needed to open gold chests will be converted to other pickups. However, the large quantities of coins generated from chests can be turned into many random pickups. Dropping Nuh Uh! at the start of the floor and then picking it back up to collect random pickups later allows for keys to collected but still gain large quantities of random pickups. Due to the large amount of pills and bombs generated, having the Bombs are Key pill effect in the pool may allow you to turn a surplus of bombs into a surplus of keys as needed.
- Golden Trinket / Mom's Box: Increases the chance of triggering to 100%.

- Rock Bottom: Permanently increases Isaac's stats when it transforms into an item that surpasses Isaac's current stats.
 - This allows the player to enter and exit a room any number of times in order to get as many stats as possible.
- BFFS!: Increases the damage to 70% of Isaac's.
- Golden Trinket / Mom's Box: Summons an additional Lil Clot.

- The Ludovico Technique: The clot's tear floats the same way Isaac's tear does. Additional clots gained from Mom's box, Found Soul, and golden versions of the trinket will have an additional floating tear.
- Tractor Beam: Lil Clot's tears travel along the beam regardless of the location of Lil Clot.
- Golden Trinket / Mom's Box: raises the chance to trigger an explosion to 100%.

- Pyromaniac: Heals on triggered explosion, rendering Isaac invincible if combined with its Golden Trinket|Golden version / Mom's Box andThe Wafer, this works only if Isaac possesses at least 1 red heart container and/or a fillable bone heart.

- King Baby: Familiars are not held in place while firing but still auto-target enemies.
- {{c|Lilith}}: Incubus can be positioned on top of Lilith, effectively removing Lilith's downside.

- Golden Trinket / Mom's Box: Has an additional 50% chance to trigger the effect again, resulting in another familiar doubling. This can be the same familiar that was doubled originally.

- Sacrificial Altar: Both the duplicated familiar (if one is available) and Brother Bobby/Sister Maggy (if not available) can be sacrificed for an item reward. This does not remove the trinket, and fully retains its effect.
- Steam Sale: Both of the discounts stack, selling familiars for 5 cents.
- Bomber Boy: Locust of War|Red locusts explode in a small horizontal cross-shape pattern.
- Brimstone Bombs: Red locusts will shoot out four brimstone beams in a + formation after hitting an enemy.
- Glitter Bombs: Red locust explosions have a chance to spawn pickups or trinkets.

- Hive Mind: Increases locusts' size and doubles their damage.
 - Red locusts’ impact damage is doubled and the explosion damage is increased to 85.
- Sad Bombs: Red locusts fire a ring of ten tears outward upon detonation, which are affected by Isaac's tear modifiers, and deal damage equal to 15 + 0.6x, where x is Isaac's Damage.
- Damocles: An additional visible item will be generated from the blind item.
- Kamikaze!: Isaac can chain-kill enemies without taking explosion damage while the shield is active.
